results.description: The group meets at Angelina's Restaurant in Tuckahoe for dinner and an interactive lessons on the opera "Tosca". The format will be as follows; three sessions meeting Oct. 5th, Oct. 12th and Oct. 19th. Dinner beginning at 5:30 p.m., lessons on the opera "Tosca" from 6:30 - 7:30 p.m., dessert from 7:30 to 8:00 p.m. Excursion to Metropolitian Opera matinee on Oct. 24th at 1:00 p.m. followed by dinner at Angelina's Restaurant. Participants will receive a CD recording of Puccini's "Tosca" and round trip transportation will be arranged. Follow up celebration on Oct. 26th at Angelina's Restaurant to process the experience. Lessons will be presented by Professor Joan Adinolfi Mallory. Head of Music Education Department, Nyack College.
results.name: An Opera Experience

results.description: We make it easy for New Yorkers to play basketball, stay active, and meet new people. ZogSports is America's most popular social sports league with organized year-round basketball leagues, offering organized fun and friendly competition. We supply the fields, the equipment, and the refs - just bring yourself and your game face! No additional fees. Sign-up with your friends or make new ones.
results.name: New York Basketball Players

results.description:
Join our Real Estate Investing Family and learn how we have acquired over 150 rental units in an 18 month period working as a TEAM.  We aren't a group of strangers passing around business cards, we are a family of local and, not so local investors that call, text, facebook, instagram, and whatever else you can think of, one another to do business deals, get help, pick each other's brains, or just to talk and hang out. We spend time getting to know each other on not just a professional level, but a personal one too. Some of my closest friends are the people in our local community. We all work toward each other's success by working together as a TEAM, a COMMUNITY, and a FAMILY. 

Are you interested in becoming part of a rapidly growing community of successful local Real Estate investors, who not only CAN help you achieve your goals, but WANT to help you?  When you succeed, we all do. 

Would you like to learn how to save money in taxes every year?

How about getting free education for yourself and your children?  A free car? A free house? or maybe get paid while on vacation?

Working with our community, you will have the opportunity to:

*Discuss/learn/develop the biggest money making strategies in today's market: Lease Options, Buy and Hold, Wholesaling, Fix and Flips, Foreclosures and REOs, Short Sales, Multi-Family Dwellings, Commercial and far more...

*Learn how rental properties are one of the best tax redeemable strategies out there...

*Learn how you can will everything you acquire to your children...

*Get locally and nationally mentored and coached by the best...

*LEARN how to go from an investor that is only making a little extra money and still working for someone else, to a SUCCESSFUL Real Estate Investor who isn't a slave to an alarm clock, and where you have the option to never work a 9-5 again. (Hello Hyena slippers and Joker PJs)...

*Find out how you can EARN substantial income while you LEARN how to invest in Real Estate full-time or part-time, without changing your schedule...

*Network with a local group of successful Real Estate Investors... 

*Save money on your taxes every year...

*Pay off your debts faster with our group's mortgage acceleration class...or/and fix your credit with out credit builders class...

*And so much more...

Some of our team invests part time while still working toward FIRING THEIR BOSSES, while others have been able to FIRE THEIR BOSS and smash their alarm clocks to invest full time. If you are interested in learning how to do this and more, RSVP for the events (MAKE SURE YOU ANSWER ALL OF THE RSVP QUESTIONS). We have a nationwide network of Real Estate Investors in addition to our local teams in the Metro Area that will show you how.

We provide the training and mentorship, all you need to do is believe in yourself, work hard and show up, not for us, but for you, for your future, and for what you believe in. 

Your life is a series of choices, so you are solely responsible for the life that you are currently living. If you want better, BE BETTER. 

If you want experience change, then CHANGE YOURSELF. YOU CAN DO IT! 

Let us help YOU.

NOTE: If you attend any of the Real Estate Saturday trainings, Cashflow game nights, property tours, webinars, or live meetings I do not keep track of your past RSVP answers, please answer the questions every time you RSVP. 

Love You Guys! See you soon!
results.name: NY/NJ Real Estate Investing for Financial Freedom

results.description: As busy professional women, we rarely take time out to enjoy a moment of relaxation and pampering. We also forget how important it is to care for our skin and have a signature polished glamour look. So it is my mission to bring women together to share self care techniques that include learning how to care for your skin and how to have a custom signature glamour look that will make you feel like the powerful woman you are called to be. So we will have meet ups that allow you to share a glass of wine and get pampered, while engaging in conversation and fun activities.

results.description: This meetup brings together a supportive community of talented locals who are interested in running classes for children. Whether you have taught kids before or not, we welcome you as long as you love them and have unique passion to share. We are here to share ideas, tips and advice to help you run a successful kids' class.

results.description: "We welcome all dancers from all over the world to check out our Salsa & Bachata events, meet new dancers, have a blast in our locations, enjoy our drink specials, but most important let's share a good solid dance together on the dance floor, all levels are welcome but remember to check out our Salsa and Bachata classes before all social dancing start ( All included with admission) What a deal, Let's MEET!"
results.name: Salsainnyc.com

results.description: Still Waters in a Storm is a one-room schoolhouse in Bushwick, Brooklyn, a reading and writing sanctuary for neighborhood children of Spanish-speaking immigrants living in poverty. As a group, every Saturday, we study a text, then each child writes something inspired by the text. Finally, each writer reads his or her writing out loud while everyone listens in a sacred hush. It's beautiful! We need kind, patient adult volunteers to sit next to children and encourage them as they write.
results.name: Still Waters in a Storm--Bushwick kids reading and writing

results.description: Are you a NYC tech start-up employee, independent tech worker, or entrepreneur? Join other tech and creative professionals at the Gowanus Breakfast Club! Share what you’re working on, meet new people, and enjoy breakfast on us! Lets meet, eat, and share great ideas along with difficult problems you are solving with technology. EnergyHub (http://www.energyhub.com) will host this monthly event, with other technology innovators slated to attend and present. Join us for breakfast catered by Gowanus’s own Runner & Stone on the third Thursday of every month, beginning September 17. We’ll meet from 9-10:30 a.m. at the Old American Can Factory, 232 3rd Street in Brooklyn.
results.name: Gowanus Breakfast Club

results.description:
ZogSports is America's most popular CoEd social sports league. Whether you just moved to New York City, looking to meet people outside of your office, bored, or looking for an excuse to have a great time with your existing friends, ZogSports is the best mix of sport and social! 

Enjoy fun and friendly competition and meet new friends through our bowling leagues.

You need something that works for you, so we offer multiple levels of competition and we play in different locations including Midtown, Downtown Manhattan and Brooklyn.

You can sign up with your own team or join as a free agent and we'll place you on a team with other fun people who are in a similar skill level.

We actually care about your experience, so we have a dedicated full time staff whose sole responsibility is making sure your league runs smoothly.

Your team will get to play for a charity your choose.  Since launch, ZogSports has donated almost $3 million to teams' charities.


Questions? Just ask!
results.name: NYC Social Bowlers

results.description: A group for those who have had life altering entheogen experiences (or are curious), and would like a community in which to integrate the lessons learned, to create a better world for us all. Integration can include dancing, drumming, meditation, yoga, tai chi, group dialogue, special events, and open mics. We are open to your suggestions and requests. Special guests will come in occasionally to speak about the current psychotherapeutic use of entheogens to help with PTSD, depression, anxiety and more.
results.name: Entheogen Integration Circle

topics.name: What does the Bible say about the Bible?

results.description: Are you a former Catholic who has left the church and is wondering “What now?”  This is a bible study just for former members of the Catholic church who have struggled  with some aspect of the Catholic church and have been led out by Christ to biblical Christianity. It is a safe place and it is intended to be a place of fellowship where understanding, compassion and respect are expressed.

results.description:
We are looking to build a community of artists, of all ages and backgrounds, to come together and share their talents in a friendly, open and supportive environment. Our meetings will take place at St. Bartholomew's in White Plains, a beautiful 100 year old stone church with fantastic acoustics and beautiful stained glass windows. Each month a guest performer, (chosen from the membership) will open the show. This will be a great opportunity for some of our braver members to really show-off their talents. Then each musician, singer, poet, or comedian will have about 10 minutes to perform (depending on turn-out). A sound system and microphones will be provided.

So join us on the 4th Saturday of each month from 6 - 9pm, and play, sing, listen, laugh or just have a great time. All ages, old and young, beginner to advanced, are welcome so bring your friends and family.                                                        

A $2.00  suggested donation is requested to performer (to defray admin. fees).                                                Light fare and beverages will be on sale with a portion of the proceeds going to local charities.

results.description: Total Wellness Connect is a rapidly-growing group, uniting health and wellness professionals with each other and their local communities through networking and online advertising! Members will enjoy: - Meetings 2x per month - Exclusivity in their chapter (1 occupation per chapter) - Online profiles on Facebook and organization's website - Quarterly community events - Educational seminars for health and wellness professionals - Programs offered for online advertising. All health and wellness professionals are welcome!
results.name: Total Wellness Connect - Manhattan - Madison Park

topics.name: Career Advice, Career Help, Interview Skills

results.description: This group is for anyone who wants to "Get Their Professional Edge On!" ... not for the faint at heart but for high-achieving people like you who are ready to be all they can be. I started this group because I believe we have all been called according to a bigger purpose. And when we step into that calling, position our expertise and serve others in our professions with the utmost passion; Watch Out! Unstoppable Success! I'm excited to build a community where we can come together and connect to better position ourselves for great achievement in your professional, personal and spiritual life.

results.description: Are you unhappy with the way you look? Are there aspects of your physical appearance that you strongly dislike? Do your negative thoughts and feelings about your looks get in the way of enjoying your everyday life? This is a support group designed especially for women and will discuss a wide range of women's issues including: body-image, building self-esteem, gender roles & expectations, relationship concerns, and sexual health. As a licensed psychologist, my group sessions provide a safe and non-judgmental atmosphere for self-exploration.

results.description: I'm starting this group to find other people from New England who have relocated to Bergen or Rockland County. I just moved here and would like to hang out with other transplants.  We can meet for dinner, drinks, catch an event, etc. (I'm open to suggestions).  There is no age limit and singles and couples are all welcome.

results.description: Are you physically fit, active or want to meet someone that is? So whether you're an athlete, a yoga enthusiast, martial arts expert, novice dancer, cyclist, or simply enjoy staying in shape, this is a group you will love!
results.name: NYC's Physically Fit, Active, & Athletic Singles

results.description:
This meetup group can be described with 2 words : Serendipity + Francophilia !

Francophilia : for those who have learned (years ago) or are learning French and want to practice and improve their conversation skills in a fun and enjoyable way with native French speakers. Also for Francophone people visiting New York, it can be a nice way to discover the city and speak French with Americans/locals!

Serendipity : During nice weather, we might do things outdoors like : going for a hike upstate (e.g.: Cold Springs, the Croton Aqueduct ; walking along the Bronx River, the NJ Palisades or along the Walt Whitman trail...) ; or exploring landmarks in the city or special places like the Chinatown of Flushing, or Coney/City Island. We could also just meet in a beautiful place like the Cloisters, Governor's Island, Lyndhurst's Rose Garden or Untermeyer Park for a picnic, enjoy a sunset in a dramatic landscape, or watch an outdoor movie. In winter or rainy weather we could visit a wing of the MET or explore the art in the metro, or even just meet for a drink in a speakeasy bar. Any activity can be an « excuse » to practice your French in a non-formal setting. The idea is to practice conversation with diversified topics/environments and currents events, popular culture, politics, economics, news, etc. We can also discuss French literature and newspaper/magazine articles and editorials. For instance a visit to sites of the Harlem Renaissance or Columbia University or the Jumel Mansion could be an opportunity to enrich ourselves with our mutual histories, all while conversing in French!

I have plenty of places in mind for our Voyages ! Alors a bientôt !
results.name: French conversation in NY - An Invitation to the Voyage !

https://youtu.be/TWpQDsolSoc

The only AMA Charted club in NJ focused 100% on Drone Racing!  Calling all serious and dedicated FPV drone racers. Looking to fly courses, hold races, exchange build information, practice together and push limits.  Every meetup will involve a race course with frequency management.   

Some locations will require AMA membership.  All Team S3 official pilots have AMA and we strongly recommend you join http://www.modelaircraft.org/]

This is an FPV proximity / race course piloting community only.  Emphasis on speed, clean builds, education and 3D parts design.   Primary formats are 250/180.  Beginners are welcome. Let us help you develop good flying etiquette and good habits.  We strive to be great examples of how to be responsible pilots.  

Our very active day to day conversations are in a slack channel.  Join this meetup, fly with us at least once and you will get an invitation.  

We the largest and most active FPV Racing team in the Tri State Area - We fly all over North New Jersey, Central New Jersey, South NJ/Philly and Bethlehem PA.


We host 3 kinds of events


• Closed Sessions - This is an internally coordinated event for existing pilots only.  We might be putting on an FPV race demo for a private group,  having a club meeting, or have a predetermined pilot list for a special event.

• Spectator Sessions - We have a predetermined pilot roster for an FPV race but the public and potential members can attend to see firsthand how are races are organized and held. 

• Open Sessions - Anyone can fly with us or attend.  Simply register for the event.  First timers will be given special instructions on how to prepare and what to expect for the first time with us.



Please visit here for more information  and our social media outlets, resources and of course, swag:

Visit our website: http://s3fpv.com/
Like us on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/s3fpv/
Race with us: http://www.multigp.com/chapters/view/...
results.name: Safety Third Racing - FPV Drone Racing and Building

results.description: This group is for small business entrepreneurs of all types; it's about connecting LOCALLY independently-owned businesses with customers, resources and each other. OUR FOCUS is LOCALISM and driving $$$ and sustainability to your business. We have a signature event called the ReMIXX every month where we feature an entrepreneur. NOW we'd like to meet to determine how we can better address the opportunities and challenges of the local change maker in a more intimate setting Our Goals 1. Create a strong member network for local innovators, equip them with the resources they need to prosper, create jobs, and function in harmony with local ecosystems. 2. Keep Dollars in the Local Economy/Reduce Capital Leakage – for every $100 spent at a locally-owned business, $73 remains in the local economy, compared to that of a non-locally owned business which only retains $43. We know that entrepreneurship fuels economic innovation and prosperity, and serves as a key means for families to move out of low wage jobs and into the middle class. 3. Increase small business visibility and foster Economic Inclusion; locally owned businesses build strong communities. By sustaining vibrant communities, linking neighbors via economic and social relationships, leading to strong healthy engaged communities. Now is the time to join forces to protect, foster, and strengthen the local businesses in our neighborhoods that give us a sense of place, ensure our diverse culture, and provide us with strong unique communities we are proud to call home

results.description:
Art Fast is an experiment in cultural mapping, a way for people to experience another culture through a medium/practice that they best understand and relate to. The aim is to share the essence of Navratri, a 9-day South-East Asian Hindu festival that celebrates the divine feminine that resides within all beings. Hindus typically fast on these days and immerse themselves in spiritual practices while they engage in community interactions. As part of the cultural mapping process, artists and other creatives will rejuvenate their creative spirits (which the goddess is believed to embody) by fasting on their art practice and engaging in community sharing. 

As you ‘fast’ on your art process, you can enjoy unique South-East Asian inspired festivities in NYC and partake in events that are exclusively organized for the participants and led by acclaimed artists, e.g. art workshops, art exhibit, panel discussion etc. Art Fast is open to all professional artists and creatives (visual artists, writers, performers, filmmakers, creative directors and chefs) living anywhere in the world. If you wish to participate and attend these workshops for free please email: contact.artfast@gmail.com by Oct 10, 2015.
results.name: Rejuvenate the creative spirit in you via ART FAST

results.description:
WELCOME TO THE #1 (and only) NEW YORK ICELANDIC LANGUAGE GROUP!

This newly created Icelandic language meetup is open to those with an interest in learning Icelandic, students of the language, as well as native speakers, to join together and practice conversation, while at the same time having fun and interacting socially! 

Here you can come with any questions you have about this very unique language, and have them answered in an unstructured, fun setting - as well as getting tips and pointers on the trickier aspects of the grammar. It is also a supportive space to actually use what you've been learning with others. 

Both a study group and an opportunity for authentic conversation, this supportive and welcoming space is devoted to all Icelandic language enthusiasts!  <br>

You should consider becoming a member of the NEW YORK ICELANDIC LANGUAGE MEETUP...

• If you've brushed up a bit on your Icelandic and would like to try your hand at speaking, then this is the place to be.  

• Perhaps you're a native speaker and haven't spoken Icelandic in ages, then this is the group to join. 

• Are you are a student and would like to ask questions about a particular grammar topic? Feel free to come join us to ask those questions you may be embarrassed to raise your hand in class for.

•  Are you a language enthusiast and were always curious about Icelandic? Then this meetup is for you.

•  Even if you simply have an interest in the country and culture, come on out and join us. We're a very dedicated, energetic and passionate group! <br>

Whatever your level, from novice to native, please join us for gatherings that are casual, friendly, relaxed, and completely bilingual.  Any language enthusiast will be sure to enjoy themselves here, and what better language than Icelandic?

All levels encouraged and welcomed!
results.name: New York Icelandic Language Meetup

results.description: Animosos aficionados al senderismo, que deseen realizar el sendero de los Apalaches (Appalachian Trail), por secciones de uno, dos o tres días de marcha, y esporádicamente algún recorrido de mayor duración, apoyándonos recíprocamente para organizar el inicio y fin de cada trayecto. Es condición hablar o conocer al menos un poco el idioma español, y estar dispuesto a hablarlo durante la actividad, como idioma preferente. Bienvenidos los senderistas anglófonos que deseen practicar su español. Caminaremos en grupo. Es necesario que cada cual tenga su equipo mínimo personal: botas de senderismo de montaña, bastones, mochila, ropa de abrigo según cada estación del año, guantes, etc. En los recorridos de un día, caminaremos secciones de aproximadamente 10 a 14 millas, del Appalachian Trail, con muy poco peso. En los recorridos de dos o tres días, caminaremos distancias algo menores (alrededor de 8 a 10 millas diarias, dependiendo de la facilidad o dificultad de cada recorrido), con la carga mínima, necesaria para transportar el equipo de acampada personal (tienda de campaña, saco de dormir, colchoneta inflable, pequeña cocinilla, comida, agua y útiles de aseo y otros). Cuando el tamaño del grupo lo permita, y haya disponibilidad, utilizaremos también los refugios existentes a lo largo del recorrido.
results.name: New York - Senderismo en español - Appalachian Trail

results.description:
In addition to our semi-annual conferences, throughout the year ONUG will conduct smaller user-centered meetings across the country focused on driving open software defined cloud infrastructure. The informal meetups will provide year round opportunities for the existing ONUG Community to engage with new IT leaders and continue the discussion on topics introduced at the semi-annual conferences.

ONUG’s mission is to guide and accelerate the adoption of open software defined cloud infrastructure solutions that meet IT end user requirements as defined through use cases, proof of concepts, and deployments to ensure user needs are met. Throughout the year, ONUG meetups will be attended by members of the ONUG Board, which is comprised of representatives from Bank of America, BNY Mellon, Cigna, Citigroup, Credit Suisse, FedEx, Fidelity Investments, Gap, Inc., Intuit, JPMorgan Chase, the Lippis Report, Morgan Stanley, Pfizer, UBS, and Yahoo.  

For more information on ONUG, visit www.opennetworkingusergroup.com

WooCommerce has emerged as the most popular method to sell online with close to 600K sites powered by WordPress and WooCommerce and over 6 million downloads. Our success has always been hinged to the amazing WordPress & WooCommerce communities.

We would love to grow our community and integrate like-minded people to talk and help each other out with everything Woo-related. Are you an avid WooCommerce enthusiast and wanting to be a part of a community of passionate developers, store owners and ecommerce specialists? We’d love you to get involved in organising our WooCommerce meetups all over the globe.

Meetups are meant to benefit the local WooCommerce community through live events and the broader WordPress community through the sharing of knowledge.

In the past year we’ve crept more and more out of our cyber shell and attended an increasing amount of WordPress events and ecommerce events. The response to all things WooCommerce has been tremendous but the need users have for collaboration and assistance is abundant. We recognize that their are limitations to what we can do for our users on WooThemes.com and thus want to create space for users (developers and store owners) to connect, help one another and see what emerges. Simply put, amazing things happen when people come together.

results.description:
So with 8.4+ million people in NYC, I find it very difficult to believe that I am the only Christian teacher who happens LOVE traveling. I don't want to sound selfish or spoiled but I travel whenever I have off from work. As a teacher, my schedule for time off is built into the year (I have no control of when I have time off and I know my schedule a year in a advance). I love teaching as I know it's a job I was called to do. I've been an Early Childhood Special Education teacher for the past 6 years. I love teaching AND traveling but unfortunately, get to do the majority of it alone. Sometimes, for certain excursions or activities, it's better to go with someone. I tend to have more fun being around people. The perk of traveling alone is that you get to meet so many cool people from around the world but I wondered if there were others like me that I can travel with? I don't smoke, drink or curse and during my travels I have come to realize that I stand out, just by not doing any of the above. I get asked about it and explain that I simply have no reason to do so (I could explain Romans 12:2, but I'm not sure they'll understand.) Some respect it and many do not. So maybe there are teachers like me out there (WHERE ARE YOU?), who have the time, interest and money to travel and want to do it with like-minded individuals! Let's travel together and not be conformed to this world BUT see the beautiful world God has created!!! There's so much out there to see and I've only touched 9% of the countries in this world. I have a lot more traveling to do!! http://www.travbuddy.com/maps/6880222

Will you Join?
results.name: Christian Traveling Educators

Temple Isaiah is a warm, welcoming, non-judgmental community of friends that welcomes all who seek a Jewish experience. 

The goal of our group is to foster an interactive community of young, Jewish professionals who wish to participate in a variety of activities at three levels: 1) primarily, social activities; 2) social action activities (in a way to give back to the local and even broader community); and 3) Jewish learning events (including a variety of classes, films and outings). 

For additional information feel free to send your inquiries to: templeisaiahyoungprofessionals@gmail.com or feel free to leave a message any time on our Meetup site. 

We hope to talk to you and see you soon!

results.description:
My name is Kenti.  If you are like me, you have dreamed of making truly great music with an amazing band of musicians that you got together.  I started this group to make your dream and my dream a reality.  Right now! 

We are creating an environment that supports each person discovering and honing our own greatness and the greatness in others.  This environment will allow people to support each other in all aspects of getting a band started, and making them successful:  Finding the right band members, building our chops, managing rehearsals, concert performances, recordings, marketing, learning the music business and getting paid for our work.  In other words doing what you love and getting paid for it.

This is not going to be your ordinary meetup group.  If you're up to participating and taking your BEST SHOT at making something great happen, I Invite you to join this group.

I am an experienced Guitarist (Jazz, Blues, Rock, Folk, R&B, Reggae), Music Teacher, Composer, Recording Engineer, and Business Manager and all-around problem solver.  I've been in bands, and currently perform solo gigs around New York and New Jersey.  I've taught guitar and piano for over 17 years. For practice, I often perform in the NYC Subway; I use those performances to invent and develop new musical ideas in front of the commuting audience.  This has already contributed to the recording of CD collection of my original music.

Your age is not important.  We will have bands with young musicians, bands with older musicians, bands with young and old mixed, and everything in between.  Come as you are - No one will be left behind!

Are you currently a concert photographer and want to finally chat with people you may have seen in the pit? results.description: Pecha Kucha ペチャクチャ , or “chit chat” in Japanese, is a concise presentation style, comprised of twenty slides at a duration of twenty seconds each that advance automatically. This format, devised by Klein Dytham Architecture, powers multi-speaker events called Pecha Kucha Nights. PKNs invite creatives of all fields to meet, present projects, and exchange ideas in 750+ cities around the world. Pecha Kucha has a global reputation for an eclectic mix of artists, activists, musicians, comedians, designers, architects, filmmakers, photographers, writers, mountaineers, et al coming together to make their patented Pecha Kucha presentation in front of an attentive, appreciative, and appropriately lubricated audience. For presenters and spectators alike, these are always great evenings.

results.description:
This meetup group is the New York chapter of Medicine X (http://medicinex.stanford.edu). Medicine X is a catalyst for new ideas about the future of medicine and health care. The initiative explores how emerging technologies will advance the practice of medicine, improve health, and empower patients to be active participants in their own care. Such emerging technologies include those that are:

• largely digital (e.g., online peer-to-peer healthcare communities, wearables);

• methodological (e.g., human-centered design and innovation, service design);

• cultural (e.g., participatory medicine, doctors and patients functioning as designers);

• and more.

This group is intended to bring together (e)patients, healthcare providers, experience designers, technologists, and researchers. The group will offer opportunities to hear from key members of these communities, experience emerging technologies, collaborate on projects, and more.

Contact the organizer(s) if you want to volunteer to speak at a meeting or recommend speakers. Contact the organizer(s) also if you are interested in providing a venue for meetings or in being a meetup sponsor, or if you would like to recommend possibilities for either.
results.name: Medicine X - New York Area

results.description:
-Are you a pretty self-aware person and yet you and your partner still get swept up in bitter fights that leave you feeling hurt and disconnected? 

-Or maybe one of you gets needy and demanding and the other partner withdraws? 

-Or maybes it seems that your partner doesn’t care about your needs and you’re living like roommates instead of soul mates? 

-Do you feel unappreciated, misunderstood, or rejected? 

Issues like these are normal in long term relationships, and there ARE proven strategies to turn your relationship around, to experience love, intimacy, and passion again! 

In this group we learn how to transform conflict into intimacy with the guidance of Relationship Coach Valerie Greene, and we share mutual support, so we can deepen our love relationships. 

Here, you'll find your community who are going through similar challenges in their relationships, and it's helpful to know that you're not alone, isn't it? I know I could have used a group like this when I chose to transform my relationship.

As of now, for a limited time, membership in this meetup is completely free, and admission to our meetings is free as well, because we want to get this information out to as many people as possible.

results.description:
Developing an Attractive Mindset Do you have any social phobia that just doesn't allow your attractive self to come out? I grew up with crazy social phobias which wouldn't allow myself to express my true personality. 

Let's face it, most of us live in our heads and we are slaves to that voice. I was fortunate to live with a life coach in personal development and learnt how to develop natural confidence by learning how to talk to MYSELF better. To become comfortable in social situations, is to develop a strong relationship with your OWN self. 

This meetup is based on: 

• Talks and discussions on social phobia behaviors such as Dealing with and Overcoming rejection Approval Seeking Social Anxiety Overly Self-conscious (especially with the opposite sex) Fear other people will judge Constant comparison to others 

• Action steps and Drills to help kill "social phobia" behavior 

• Exercises you can do at home to strengthen the relationship with yourself.

***Events and talks will be catered to  men or women,  and sometimes both***

results.description:
For those who find the idea of a virgin birth mind-numbing, the concept of "original sin" brain-straining, or an all-powerful and loving, yet jealous and vindictive, deity problematic, we invite you to spend time with similarly thinking folks.

HopeLines, a non-denominational and utterly, non-traditional church, offers an alternative to the traditional religious overhead of blind faith, endless guilt, and questionable rationality. We focus on the wisdom teachings attributed to the ancient sages. With 78% of the American population purporting some measure of Christianity, HopeLines includes, but is not limited to, the discourses ascribed to Jesus.

Our appeal is to those for whom spiritual freedom trumps religious restraints, and the notion of God is not taboo, supernatural, human-like, or humanized.

Through the precepts of ancient sages such as Lao Tzu, Siddhartha Gautama, Ptah-hotep, and Jesus (to name a few), HopeLines' mission is to encourage ways of thinking and living that:

● Build and maintain our birthright of excellent character.

● Embody active compassion as a celebration of life and living.

● Practice innate wisdom as our alignment with the God within and without.

● Unite Mind and Spirit to actualize our awesome potential.

"We believe that our goal is to meld with the powerful, yet subtle, law of our existence:" says Rev. Alexander, facilitator of HopeLines Church, "the law of cause and effect. Some call it God."

ABOUT HopeLines

HopeLines is a non-denominational, non-traditional church. Focused on living clearly, cleanly, and wisely, HopeLines awakens and celebrates the God in us all.  (Read more at our website, http://hopelines.org.)
results.name: New York Spiritual Growth Meetup

results.description:
Franglish is an unique and innovative French/English and Spanish/English language exchange event taking place every week from 7 to 9pm in some of the best venues across New York City.

Franglish organises events in more than 10 cities in France and in the UK (and now in the USA) and our community has more than 50 000 members. Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/LanguageExchangeNewYork

Practicing is the best way to learn a language and you'll discover French/Spanish/English culture with locals and foreigners. FREE events (tip supported, give what you want at the end of the event).

Over 30 people attend each event. Your French/Spanish/English doesn't have to be perfect, a lot of people come who speak very little French/Spanish/English.

Discover Franglish and its unique format of 1-to-1 conversations that last for 14 minutes (7 min in English, 7 min in French or Spanish), that gives you the opportunity to meet many native speakers. But Franglish doesn’t just stop there. Ask around – you’ll find that many people find their friends at Franglish.
results.name: French/English and Spanish/English Language Exchange in NYC

results.description:
Are you a 20/30 something in the Central NJ area who loves Craft Beer, Wants to visit local breweries, attend tap take overs, or just meet at a local happy hour? This is the meet up for you!


Rules for the group: 

Please keep an updated picture on your profile so you're easy to find at events

Please do not be a fly on the wall looking at events we have, and actually sign up and join us, that's why you joined to begin with...right?

Please do not be a craft beer snob. Some people are new to Craft Beer, and some know their stuff. If you know your stuff, be nice and maybe teach someone about it! If you are new, welcome and enjoy the experience :)

Please sign up and pay at your first event, the small $5 fee helps us run the group it is not free, plus we often have get together's where supplies are needed.
results.name: Central Jersey 20's & 30's Craft Beer Meet up

results.description:
Jersey Girls Creative presents Creative Lessons! Creative lessons are group presentations/interactions  and workshops all revolving around the topics Social Media Marketing, Search Engine Optimization, and Website Design for business... "Not Giving you fish, but teaching you how."

Presentation Leader Katie Maroldi: 

Prior to joining Jersey Girl Creative this young dynamo started Mo’s Media, a Social Media Marketing company, from the ground up.

Katie is a born leader: from Pace University Graduate in Communications and Public Relations to Social Media Director at Prana Marketing, a boutique marketing and public relations firm, Katie is at the helm of Jersey Girls Creative’s social media marketing and campaigns.

Katie Maroldi has also worked directly with SCORE, a national non-profit organization dedicated to helping emerging and existing small businesses maximize their potential for success, as a Social Media Workshop presenter.

Prior to Prana Marketing, Katie interned at several New York City PR firms specializing in consumer product marketing, Broadway shows, celebrities, and theater, creating grass roots digital marketing campaigns. There is no challenge too big or too small for Katie and she will find a solution to flawlessly execute any marketing initiative.
results.name: Creative Lessons

results.description:
Hello, Chinese, Japanese or Korean (CJKE) language Masters!

Note: Please include a real, clear photo of yourself. Fake, or pictures of animals or objects will not be allowed and you will not be approved. Thank you for your cooperation.

To join our language focuses sister group please join: https://www.meetup.com/Chinese-Japanese-Korean-Practice/

 Have you taken all the language classes in CJK or ESL but still find hard to actually practice with other native speakers in the language of interest? Do you seek a real world setting where you can find CJK and English speaking bilingual people in which you can gain practice partners and lifelong friendships/relationships? Are you new to American or NYC? Are you American but proficient in one of the CJK languages because of your parent’s culture and ethnicity? Have you worked abroad in one of the CJK countries?

If you answered yes to any of these questions, then this meetup is for you. We hold bi-weekly or monthly social events at bars, lounges, and rooftops around NYC. You will feel invigorated to explore the city and practice your languages and culture in real time. Membership is FREE! All level of learners are welcome: from beginner to advanced learners or native speakers of Chinese (Mandarin or Cantonese), Japanese, Korean or English are welcome. Here, you will make a lot of language exchange friends here and practice partners.

Come join us at our next social event and party by signing up!
results.name: Chinese, Japanese, Korean (CJK), and English (Night-Life)

results.description: This group is for private companies in New York with the infrastructure, assets and vision to succeed that could also benefit from additional support in: 1) Identifying appropriate pools of capital to fund the continued growth of their businesses 2) Attaining introductions to potential strategic partners 3) Inking relationships to pursue mergers, acquisitions and/or sales 4) Attaining strategic advice for maximizing shareholder value and/or monetizing assets.  We are effectively a coworking space with an elite ecosystem of companies, and we strive to provide the resources companies require to succeed.  To apply for admission, please visit our website at http://www.wallstreetshare.com.  Wall Street Share was formed on the premise that there are a plethora of private companies with significant potential that are unable to identify the capital and/or strategic relationships required to make their businesses successful -- oftentimes a capital infusion or valuable introduction makes all the difference in dictating the course of a venture.  We thoroughly enjoy meeting leaders who are involved in interesting endeavors, learning about their businesses and helping them. We formed this group to reach out to managers involved in businesses in which they are passionate, and we envision creating an ecosystem of promising and innovative companies that are keen on sharing ideas, discussing their stories and needs and attaining the assistance they require to succeed.
results.name: New York Companies Seeking Access to Resources & Capital

results.description: Looking for fashion savvy NYers interested in learning how to better manage finances or willing to share their tips on how to grow and maintain wealth, preferably in the 25 - 50 age range.  Come join us to show off your own unique personal style and talk money-matters with interesting individuals just like yourself.  What's a typical gathering like, you ask?...A little bit of mix & mingle, a brief intro of yourself to the group (please dress up as we encourage you to share with us what you're wearing and, if you're comfortable divulging, roughly how much it cost. Remember, we want to be fashionable AND fiscally responsible).  Expect to be inspired, expect to be educated, expect to be yourself and make new connections with like-minded individuals, EXPECT TO HAVE FUN!

results.description: Welcome to the Tribe of sensual seekers and explorers who are interested in Pleasure Evolution. We host educational events with a focus on creating sex-positive, poly-friendly, kink-friendly community. It is a place to share the journey with like-minded friends and Lovers. It is a place for us to be reminded that Love is an Intention, and that we are all deserving of joy and pleasure. Celebrate your victories and growth with us. Share your obstacles. Create deeper intimacy, by sharing and letting us see you. Invite us to do fun things with you! Everything is Welcome.

results.description: Each month, we will explore ideas of consciousness, healing and spirituality expressed through various authors. We will enjoy lively, spirited discussion about how these ideas resonate with us, our relationships with others, and our world in general. We meet the first Wednesday of each month from 7:00 - 8:30 pm at the renowned Wainwright House in Rye, one of the oldest holistic learning centers in the country.

results.description: The NYC Future of TV Content Group is an open professional think tank for the media and entertainment industry to better understand where content consumption is headed within the next 5 to 10 years. The objective is to break down walls between media professionals including researchers and consumer insights professionals, content producers, media buyers and planners, marketers and technologists to glean better insights on trends that affect everyone.
results.name: NYC Future of TV Content Group

results.description:
Each Suppers meeting has its own purpose and personality. There are only three non-negotiable principles common to all meetings: 

1. that we all actively practice non-judgment 

2. that we all prepare meals from single, whole, fresh foods with very limited processed food 

3. that we all avoid commercial messages and the promotion of any particular diet, product or service 

Beyond that, facilitators create meetings based on their own particular passions, be it teaching people to prepare raw vegan meals, to managing or reversing diabetes through lifestyle change, to teaching people how to transition the family taste buds from junk to healthy food. We do this by creating safe and friendly settings where people with food-related health challenges can develop and manage their own personal transition to a healthier lifestyle. We focus on preparing healthy mood-stabilizing meals from whole foods, including easy one-pot meals like soups, stews, chili, salads, and slaws. Forge new friendships and get support based on healthy living.  The program is free to users except for the shared cost of the meal, about $15/meeting. Feel free to visit our main website for additional information and other meetings not posted on MeetUp.com - www.thesuppersprograms.org

Please note that active participation in Suppers Meetups is required to be a continuing member.  The goals of the program cannot be achieved if you cannot attend in person.  Cooking, eating, and meeting together is the underlying foundation of Suppers.  So if you are unable to attend 3 meetings in a 12 month period, you will be removed from the Meetup.  You are free to rejoin when your schedule permits your presence at meetings.
results.name: Vegan Suppers in the Bronx

results.description: This is a group for people interested in learning more about early American Traditional and folk art, as well as meet others with this same interest. I started this group to attend art exhibits, lectures, classes, art shows, and historic locations.
results.name: Early American Traditional and Folk Art Meetup

results.description:
This is a group designed to bring together researchers from all areas of big data and security research.  Monthly events will be held at the AT&T offices at 33 Thomas Street, New York, NY 10007.  These events will feature talks presented by experts in fields from a wide range of computer and data science topics, including databases, machine learning, networking, security, statistics, and data visualization.  Refreshments will be provided before or after each talk to encourage discussions and foster potential collaborations between members.  As seating is limited, all members must RSVP to each event and a photo ID is required upon entering the building.

This group is organized by members of the the AT&T Labs Big Data Research organization and the AT&T Security Research Center.  More information about upcoming seminars and our NYC offices can be found on our AT&T NYC Research Seminar Series webpage.
results.name: AT&T NYC Research Seminar Series

results.description: Join Coffee House Discussions (CHD) – a series of intimate forums at a local cafe designed for the South Orange/Maplewood community to share their thoughts and ideas (topics vary per event) around a sustainable, FULLY integrated community. Meeting locations alternate between Maplewood and South Orange. This event is brought to you by the South Orange/Maplewood Community Coalition on Race.
results.name: Coffee House Discussions

results.description: Welcome! The NYC Inter-Connected Professionals Networking Group is a diverse mix of respected, ambitious professionals from similar, related or overlapping fields, dedicated to networking, collaborating with each other on events, workshops and seminars, promoting one another's businesses, and sharing resources for successful business growth and development. Some of our concrete goals are: -- Sharing referrals of potential clients, and sharing *sources* of client referrals with one another; -- Sharing and discussing various other networking events that we can each attend, while promoting each other and ourselves at these events; -- Sharing and exchanging valuable resources, such as online advertising mediums, social media marketing, tips on bookkeeping programs, cost-cutting measures, and -- Collaborating on potential workshops or speaking engagements together or individually, which can promote our respective businesses or services.
results.name: The NYC Inter-Connected Professionals Networking Group

results.description:
The Art League of the Chathams (ALC) is a supportive community of visual artists living in the Chatham area of NJ. The League's mission is to nurture the artistic development of its members and to foster an appreciation of their work in the community. League membership is open to visual artists and art enthusiast who live in Chatham Township, Chatham Borough and near-by towns.

The major role of ALC is to exhibit members’ art work at the Chatham Township Municipal Building (at 58 Meyersville Road) and at the Chatham Borough Municipal Building (at 54 Fairmount Ave). ALC members also have opportunities to display their work at other venues in the area. 

Current members of Art League of the Chathams (ALC) can automatically join the group for free as long as their dues are up to date. 

Don't know our group and are you interested in our events? JOIN US on this site and follow the direction how to become ALC member. ALC membership dues are $20 for an individual, $30 for a couple/family annually. Detailed information regarding benefits and how to pay the dues can be found on our website. http://www.artleagueofthechathams.org/id6.h... or on this site under "More" and "Files" ('Benefits' file and 'Join' file). Artist who are not current members and would like to join have 60 days trial period. Once you send in your dues, your profile will state "exempt from dues".  

Important: Please DO NOT pay trough Meetup service. The ALC meetup site is managed by an individual person and the payment would be send to her. The payment NEEDS TO BE SENT to ALC treasurer as described in links/file.  

For more detailed information please visit our website at: www.artleagueofthechathams.org
results.name: Art League of the Chathams     ALC

results.description:
We are a self-organizing group of practitioners, inspired by Frederic Laloux's book "Reinventing Organizations", committed to supporting organizations and leadership to evolve and embody the qualities of "Teal" - Self-Management, Evolutionary Purpose, and Wholeness.

We will be exploring the ideas, principles, and practices from Laloux's book, as well as other related material, through facilitated conversations and exercises. We will often use tools and methods from the Art of Hosting, a collaborative approach to participatory leadership and decision-making. Our members are invited and encouraged to show up with their curiosity and excitement and to find ways to contribute to our budding community.

Through our meetings we hope to provide the soil (community) in which new seeds (ideas) can be planted, fertilized, and nourished, eventually growing to become healthy expressions of creativity (projects) that connect and support each other to give rise to a new eco-system (social structures).

Join us if you are:

• frustrated with the current way that your organization operates in terms of meetings, management, strategy, and execution, and you know there must be a better way;

• passionate about unleashing the potential of business as a force for good and aligning enterprise with purpose;

• sensing that there is a significant shift occurring in our social systems and wondering how it applies to organizations and how you can contribute to the transition;

• looking to connect with like-minded individuals who are also working to make our organizations function in a more healthy, dynamic, and life-affirming way
results.name: Teal Organizations NYC Community of Practice

results.description:
Holistic Harlem is a meet-up inspired by years of wellness studies of varied modalities. As New Yorkers, our needs are both Soulful and practical. Living a life of purpose in Harlem, means you can't leave one behind. It also means intuition may be our greatest untapped gift and resource for better living. This MeetUp is for those committed to having a socially conscious mindset, who focus on solutions and explore the dynamic inner world, as much as the outer one.

*For the safety of our members it's important that we confirm member requests based on common interests and an identifiable thumbnail.
results.name: Holistic Harlem Meetup

We provide support for those in search of becoming citizens of the U.S, provide English classes for those willing to learn and much more!!! This will be a group where you will meet other immigrants that you can confide in and learn from, perhaps someone has already gone through what you are going through.
results.name: New York Immigration Meetup

results.description:
This is an acoustic instrumental slow jam focusing on tunes in the following traditions: Irish, English, New England Old Time, French Canadian, American Southern, and maybe even Scandinavian. Tunes are those that are typically suitable for contra dancing or other traditional fiddle tunes. This group is intended to provide a musical home for folks interested in playing tunes with other musicians, learning to play by ear and overall increasing their own musical skill. It’s fun and welcoming to all ages (see venue for 21+ restrictions) and levels of playing. 

What do we mean by SLOW JAM? All acoustic instruments (e.g., fiddle, mandolin, guitar, cello, etc.) are welcome and we play songs that typically follow the AABB format (two “A” parts followed by two “B” parts) and we will simply play it over many repeats and if you know it, great (!), but if you don’t, you try to figure it out as we go along, maybe picking up a few notes here and there.  There's no pressure, but it can be a challenge!

All levels? Yes! This jam will be at a speed that is accessible to advanced beginner, but welcome to all levels.

Please click on the "Pages" tab for more a more detailed description.
results.name: Brooklyn Traditional Slow Jam

results.description:
Ski and snowboard carpools. Why? Because buses are great but they're not for everyone. Because driving alone is expensive and not having a ride is a tragedy. Because you want to help the planet and shred as often as possible. 

We want to help. We're organizing weekly happy-hours in NYC and NJ, and weekend carpools to the mountains. Connect and carpool by attending a Meetup and posting to http://www.shredshare.io/carpools. 


Shred soon,


The Shredshare Team

Access | Community | Conservation

team@shredshare.io

www.shredshare.io

results.description: Join us in advancing our public speaking etiquette. You will benefit from hands on practice in almost every meeting through fun activities, taking the pressure off and turning the fun on. Not only will you improve your public speaking and leadership skills but you will do so among welcoming friends who share the enthusiasm of networking while learning. Our group meets every 1st & 3rd Thursday at 12:00 pm - 1:00 pm located at 2 Penn Plaza, between 31 & 31 Street, contact our VP of membership, Ivan, for further information at (646)-326-7354 or email us at ivanfarkas.tm@gmail.com ......and in life always remember, don't forget to Speak Up!

results.description: Open Source is a place where art and community come together. Impacted by the open source movement—which promotes freely shared, educational software and information—Open Source applies a similar philosophy to create an approachable space, dedicated to the accessibility of contemporary art. Our programming includes monthly exhibitions, lectures, storytelling, dinners, and community programs. We also offer kids workshops that explore the intersection of art, technology, and the environment. Join us for good conversation--whether it’s during an exhibit, over dinner, through a workshop, or just for fun!
results.name: Open Source Gallery

results.description:
Are you a delicious, savory Chinese crepe slathered with egg, generously sprinkled with green onions and parsley and black sesame, and wrapped around a crunchy sheet of unknown origins? Were you brought into existence by a middle-aged Beijing man of stern yet kindly aspect, operating out of the DongCheng district at all hours of the night? THEN THIS IS THE GROUP FOR YOU.

(We are currently closed to new members.)
results.name: New York Jianbing Meetup

results.description:
This meet up is for Independent Workers, whether you are doing it full time, or just on the side to earn extra income. If you work for one of the new On-Demand platforms, like Uber, Postmates, Shyp, TaskRabbit, Gigwalk or many others. Join us to discuss the new platforms that are popping up, offering more work opportunities. Your fellow workers will especially be interested in hearing about your experiences with the various platforms. 

Howe are you maintaining work/life balance?  What are the most marketable skills?

Being on your own - how do you handle the complexities of working for yourself  / 1099 or W2 - the pros and cons

We want to meet in order to learn from each other's experiences and maybe tell a few stories about your craziest gigs along the way.
results.name: New York On-Demand and Gig Economy Workers

results.description: Pickup Soccer NYC held its first games in Summer 2006 and was the first, organized pickup soccer organization to exist in NYC. PSNYC is a co-ed, recreational soccer group playing organized soccer games in Manhattan and Brooklyn year-round. The group comes together around playing the sport for fun, not competition and we do not keep score at games. Our games are informal and recreational with an emphasis on NON-competitive play. PICKUP SOCCER NYC is an organized, co-ed recreational group that holds open soccer games year-round several days a week at playing fields across Manhattan. All games are held on full-sized grass/turf playing fields with anywhere from 12-30 players per given game. Attendance is optional once you sign up and you can attend as few or as many games as you wish. The group is composed of players of all ages, backgrounds and nationalities. We are not a league nor do we use refs or officials. We moderate games ourselves making our own calls. We do not keep score. The group is open to all skill levels and our membership encompasses a mix of playing experience and abilities - from beginner to former pro.
results.name: PSNYC / Pickup Soccer NYC Soccer - Meetup Group

results.description: ... because who hasn't wanted to be smooth on the dance floor?  We'll work through fundamentals of some popular dances, then use what we've learned as the DJs provide the soundtrack to our night!  Instructors will include anecdotes about cultural points of interest & social dance etiquette.

results.description: PUNTO Events & Performances MeetUp is a community-based group created to build meaningful connections within the arts community and among event professionals interested in learning and growing together. Because we are artists, we well understand members of the performing arts community often need a home away from home. Because we have a for-profit, mission based venue, we understand meeting and event professionals need community, too. We are not going to be looking for part-time jobs to supplement our income when the income from the primary job is not enough. Rather we will resolve to start at least a part-time business. We will discuss various networking marketing opportunities out there and choose those that we are interested in pursuing. Make magic happen for you and your family. Join us now!
results.name: New York Network Marketing Pros Meetup

results.description:
What is Covet?  Covet is a mobile app game (iphone, ipad, ipod, or android phone) for fashion inspiration.  Players can shop and style with real brands and best of all enter fashion challenges with other fashion gurus or wannabees.  It's a competitive bunch but we also like to have fun and share our closets (at least in the game)!

I know there are plenty of Covet Fashion players in the NYC/NJ areas so I thought I would start a meet-up group for those of us who want to share our love of fashion, game playing, and other fun hobbies.

This group is for 21+ adults.  Please no solicitations for products or services.
results.name: Covet Fashion Addicts (Those who love the game!)

results.description:
Hi my name is Monifa and I am a self-professed Francophile. For years I've traveled to France trying to improve my French only to lose most of it when I returned to New York. Well, I've decided to change that...I'm starting the Harlem French Club! 

Have you ever wished that you would have stuck with your high school or college French classes so that you would now be fluent? Hmmm, did you let that dream of being fluent fade away because you didn't have anyone to practice with? Do you know that there are 38 countries outside of France where French is the official language....think of all the possibilities where you can speak French while traveling around the world to enrich your cultural experience! That's freaking huge!! (C'est freaking énorme!!) 

The Harlem French Club will meetup to learn and practice speaking French; learn about French culture in France, as well as learn about the countries where French is the official language…..including the 26 countries in Africa!!! Having spent time in West African French speaking countries, this will be an interesting and exciting experience.

The Harlem French Club will also go to movies, restaurants; cultural events around the city and meet native speakers from around the francophone world!

Merci et j'espère vous voir bientôt!

Monifa
results.name: The Harlem French Club

results.description: This group is for gay guys in NYC that enjoy playing Canasta.

results.description:
I have had plenty of experience dating online. I have been asked many times, by fellow female friends how to navigating through online dating sites. It was suggested that I widen the circle.

I am encouraging other middle-aged women ages 50-60 to join this group.  We can share, discuss our experiences in addition to offer advice to each other. 


Until we actually schedule a Meetup, please follow the "Discussion" forum. Feel free to reply and add your experience. I started posting a couple topics and sharing my experience.


Pictures of potential dates will NOT be posted online.  We will have occasional gatherings to meet in New York and Connecticut. It will a nice out for women who would like to share ....
results.name: Women Looking Out 4 each other Online Dating - Tri

It's a beautiful region we live in - let's enjoy it together! Most of our meet ups will take place off of the train route and will be followed by happy hour - what better way to end a hike :) Hope to see you on the trails with us!

Since all change comes from within, people are invited to connect more deeply inside themselves to uncover and experience new ways of being who they most naturally are.

results.description: This group will focus on the works of great writers of the 19th and 20th centuries including, but not limited to, Melville, Twain, Tolstoy, Dostoevsky, Wharton, Steinbeck, Woolf, and Hemingway. Members will take turns leading each discussion by providing a brief bio of the author and asking relevant questions about the text. Members are encouraged to make suggestions for future readings. If you love great writing and enjoy a lively discussion and dissection of plot and characters, you will love being part of this group.
results.name: Staten Island Classic Books Meetup

results.description:
FOREVER YOUNG (45ish) AFRICAN AMERICAN  CLUB.

FOREVER YOUNG!! 
This Club was created  to encourage  Men and Women (45 years and older)to get out of the house, meet new people, socialize, and enjoy life to the fullest. We want members to have a sense of belonging. A Club that meets 1-2 times per month with liked minded and interest minded members. Our goal is to enjoy life NOW.


All are welcome to join. Please join us if you would like to meet other  African American  in the Metro Area and Beyond.

Men/women/seniors/ visitors/tourist/ retirees/professionals/entrepreneurs/community group members/ church group members/employed/unemployed/etc.
If you are looking to make friends with fun loving and positive people, then this is the Club for you.


Events and Activities of  Cultural interest:

The City has a lot to offer and we are going to explore all the City's hidden gems.

Concerts/plays/party get together/ trips/cruises/ community events/park events/movies/church events/boat rides/family events/casino/bingo/tennis/ seminars/lunch/ brunch/movie/spoken word/adult round table talk/ travel/etc. The possibilities are endless.


 DON’T LET MONEY STOP YOU FROM JOINING!
We’ll search for discounts that are available to our group members.
(Senior discounts, group discounts, coupon programs, club discount program, restaurant discounts, etc.


SUGGESTIONS ARE WELCOME!!

If you have a suggestion for an event, please share .
If you have information of a discount program , please share it with the group. We're here to make friends, participate, save money whenever possible and have lots of fun. 


 REQUIREMENTS:
All members are required to participate in events as often as possible. The more times the better.

Club will meet 1-2 times per Month. This will give members enough time to plan for  events.

 
RULES AND REGULATIONS:
1) An Annual Membership Dues of $8:00  are required before or after the Trial period. (Trial Period 14 days).  Dues are Once per year. However,FOR 1ST EVENT, DUES ARE REQUIRED.

2) Annual Payments are accepted in person or online. (Once per year).
3) Dues help to defray the cost to Meetup.com, purchasing membership in discount clubs, and organizing the monthly operation of this Club
4) Please be mindful of Organizers time and effort.
5) Please be courteous to all Club Members.
6) A NO SHOW after RSVP is not acceptable. You’ll be REMOVED after 2 NO SHOWS.
7) Lateness is not acceptable.
8) Please remember that I value  YOU. You’ll always feel welcome in this Club..

 
Thank you for your support.
I hope to meet you at an event soon.

 
PLEASE JOIN TODAY!
Best regards.
Laurel

topics.name: Grief Support for Partners and Spouses

results.description:
Loss of Spouse, Partner, Sibling, Friend…
Grieving is a universal part of life; it is also very personal. We need to be in the company of others who understand. It is helpful to be in a respectful, caring and guiding environment in order to make the necessary transitions that deep losses challenge us with. This group offers a safe place where members can “just be” or share, and to support others and be supported as well. Family and Friends often don't get it, have their own issues, or make us feel like we are burdening them.

The fee is waived if you have eligible health insurance; out of pocket the fee is $20.00.
results.name: NJ Grief Support Meetup

15 lifts including an eight-passenger Northwoods Gondola and two luxurious high-speed quads keep you out of lines, with more time on our four peaks and in our parks. And with six dining options scattered across the mountain, you can refuel and keep skiing or riding without missing a beat.

We're winter enthusiasts and we're serious about snow quality. Gore's energy-efficient snowmaking equipment spans 95% of our resort, so each run, each turn, and each day is great.  Enjoy winter with the whole Gore Mountain family and experience how beautiful it is here!  (and how fun the glades are after a snowstorm, the exquisite view from Cloud on a bluebird day, or the southern sunshine of the never-ending Topridge trail)

Benefits range from relaxation to a much deeper understanding of who we are, and ultimately to the profound freedom which is often called enlightenment.Our teacher, Linda Clair, gives group instruction as well as individual guidance. Linda teaches two simple, very effective techniques in a non-sectarian way – observing the breath, and slow walking meditation. topics.name: Forex Expert Advisors and Managed Accounts

results.description:
T4T Meet Up Agenda 

Since there's been no readily available 'source' of experienced information in the market most traders bounce from one approach to another, waste a gazillion hours watching webinars from 'so-called experts' and continually experiment with 'miracle trade systems'. 

Trading is a journey that should always grow and develop as you learn more about the market and about yourself. But it's extremely important to have the 'Foundation' knowledge: understand how the market works, how the main players (the bankers) analyse and execute their trades. 

Once you have this foundation you can then apply all sorts of methods and tools to 'enhance' your performance. You'll find things that are a complete waste of time and others that are pure gold! 

Sharing Our Experience

This meet up is all about sharing the 'foundation' knowledge to get you on the path to success as a trader. We hope to meet fellow traders and share trading strategies and styles which can hopefully improve all of our performance. 

Whether you are interested in learning to trade or finding ways to invest your money in trading, a visit to this meetup is all you'll need to get started: beginner, intermediate and professional traders and investors are all welcome.

At the very least it's a great opportunity to meet like-minded people and share a few trading stories from the investment banking days whilst having a few drinks!

Come along and let's meet up.... I can assure you it'll definitely be worth your while!

Note: Many members have tried to join up, and then spam the group to sell them something, like the latest magical EA (trading robot), or the "secret" strategy.   Sorry, but you won't last long in this group.  We can smell a rat a mile off!
results.name: New York Traders Meet Up

Ethical Brew's goal is to bring together like-minded people to share their musical experiences within both the Folk and Social Action Communities. We always provide a period of time for those attending the Meetup to interact with each other and the performers over coffee and cake. 

Ethical Brew is an all-volunteer organization. Fifty percent of the proceeds from each show are allocated to funding worthy social action projects, charities, organizations and progressive causes that reflect the humanist values of the Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County selected by the Artists. The remaining 50% helps to fund initiatives of the Ethical Culture Society, a non-profit organization. 

Past beneficiaries of our shows include WhyHunger, Edeyo Foundation (Haiti), Heifer International, Bergen County Sanctuary Committee, Ramapo-Bergen Animal Sanctuary and Doctors Without Borders...

A forum to discuss the global energy markets, share ideas, and network. I've got great access to energy investors across hedge funds, private equity firms, etc. that will join our forum for discussion, as well as colleagues at public and private companies in the global energy industry across all of the business segments (E&P, oilfield service, equipment, refining, drilling, etc.) and government contacts that would like to be featured as guest speakers (casually) at our forums.

Topics we will discuss:

- Natural gas: supply/demand - markets finally tightening in 2016? The ultimate copportunity. 

- Oil supply: growth is finally slowing down - are we reaching an inflection point?

- Can domestic oil and gas producers actually live within cash flows in 2016?

- What happens when companies don't have hedges in 2016?

- How to invest in oil and gas companies 101 - learn from the investor who called the collapse in oil and gas prices 

- NGL markets - will they ever recover? 

- Why we don't understand Carl Icahn's investment in Cheniere

-  Oilfield services and the never-ending story of overcapacity.

Our goal is to qualify as an official BNI Core Group. To begin, we need a minimum of 15 Founding Members.

APPLY NOW BEFORE YOUR COMPETITOR DOES.

Our networking group is amassing professionals of any stamp — but only one per profession!

results.description:
What is StartupBlink?

StartupBlink is an interactive global startup ecosystem map featuring tens of thousands of listed entities, including new startups, coworking spaces and accelerators. Add yours as well! http://StartupBlink.com

StartupBlink hosts 100 meetup groups in cities all over the world, and New York is one of them!

Why should you join this Meetup?

Do you want to find co-founders or partners? Meet like-minded people? Grow your business faster? Learn how to hire smarter?  

Then come to your city's next StartupBlink meetup!

Meetups are for startup founders, coworking and accelerator staff members, or anyone who works in the local startup community. We love to have new members in our networking and special events!

Who organizes the events?

The events are organized by the local startup community (that means you!). Our networking events happen in the last week of each month, but additional events are welcomed as well, so please let us know if you want to organize a meetup and we will post it. All meetups are hosted in accordance with the terms of use posted on www.StartupBlink.com

What can you expect from our meetups?

Firstly, our meetup events are all about networking. You can expect to meet like-minded entrepreneurs and create the contacts that will help you grow your project.

You and your fellow group members can decide on how to use your local meetup to your advantage. You can have general discussions or specific presentations and lectures. We welcome you to attend your local meetup and get in touch with us directly to share suggestions and ideas.

We will hold events about cybersecurity, engineering, entrepreneurship, and more. Join our group and you will be presented with great opportunities to learn from experts and network with professionals in your field.

results.description: Who is it for? Technology is advancing at a rapid pace. Established companies and startups alike work hard to capitalize on these technology development to be the most competitive in the market. At the same time, global regulators struggle to understand and pass laws regarding these technologies, sometimes providing vague guidance, sometimes overly restrictive. But in every case, in any country, and for any business operations companies are required to comply with the laws. Given the rapid developments and complexity of cyber security and technology regulation, when companies get it wrong, they often face damages including fines, litigation costs, repetitional damages, incarceration and/or shut down of operations. This forum is to help application/platform designers, startups and established businesses alike discuss and gain a better understanding of the cyber security and technology requirements that they are facing. Anyone is welcome that is looking to understand or share advice on existing or upcoming regulations applicable to certain technologies, business operation requirements, platform design, and more. What are we discussing? This forum is created to discuss and provides assistance with the following concerns: 1.) What are the technology and cyber security requirements already in place for my product design / business operations? I feel like I must be missing something... 2.) I want to start / continue a business in a relatively new field of technology and am afraid I'll get fined or shut down before I've even come close to making it. What are the regulations and where are they headed? (e.g. How do I understand existing regulations and the trajectory of global government regulation in these developing sectors like drone/UAV, crypto currency, machine/artificial intelligence and more...) 3.) I know that I am required to do this one thing for my business/product design, but I don’t know how. How are other people doing it? And how do I know if I have to do it in another country? 4.) I wish I could talk to the people making the technology and cyber security laws for my industry (e.g. FinTech, HealthTech, etc...) to tell them what the tech is really like in my business, and maybe get some understanding of what they are getting at with their laws! How can I do that? ...and more. How are we meeting? Each meeting will consist of a forum providing compliance advice for a specific aspect of the technology sector (e.g. WCAG guidelines for website/app design, payment systems compliance issues, cryptocurrency issues, etc...), followed by a Q&A for items to be discussed either at that meeting or answered in the following meeting. The meetings will start in November and will be held on a monthly basis. We look forward to seeing you there! For any questions you would like to submit to discussion, please feel free to e-mail the organizers at info@helm.global
results.name: CATCH: Cyber and Technology Compliance (w/ Helm)

Si te gusta bailar, pasear por la montaña, probar nuevos restaurantes, echarte unos traguitos, tomarte un cafecito o cualquier otra cosa, este es el grupo para ti. Ya que el grupo es nuevo no he planeado nada por ahora pero en lo que se vaya uniendo gente ire viendo.

Acerca de mi: yo naci y me crie en Venezuela, pero llevo ya 7 años en Estados Unidos viviendo entre California y Texas. Soy ingeniera y trabajo en el area de eficiencia energetica. Me encanta salir a bailar y a pasear por la ciudades donde vivo.

Whether you are new to New York (like me), or you've been here a while, the idea for this Meetup is to connect all the latinas out there who are looking for girlfriends to explore this city with.

If you want to go dancing, grab dinner or drinks (including coffee), go hiking in the mountains, check out an exhibit or a concert, or simply have a wine and cheese night with girlfriends, this is the place for you. I am open to activity suggestions, so feel free to message me.
