results.description:
This group is for anyone who has lost their spouse/partner and wants to be with other people who "get it". The group will meet in a restaurant so we can have fun social time while getting to know each other. All members will be able to post any activity that members would like to do and join in on. I hope to have all members feel comfortable to post anything that they are doing and would like someone to do it with.. such as a movie, show , walk, etc... We can be there for each other... through the loneliness and through the fun times..

    We are NOT a support group in that formal manner but we DO support each other by conversing and sharing our feelings and what we did in the same situation.

I visited another group that was an hour away and was inspired to start a group in this area. I felt the comradery  between the members and saw how much fun they had being together.

My vision for this group is that we will gain friends who we can do things with, plan other activities for the group and combat the loneliness that comes from losing our spouse. I lost my husband 9 months ago and understand completely how walking this path feels. Lets walk it together!

results.description:
We are a sophisticated, well-designed yet unpretentious guild for those cultured, polished lesbians that have grappled to find equivalently high-quality significant others and equally minded lesbian friends. The Society was founded on the belief that NYC’s finest lesbians have been really struggling to find equally high quality contemporaries, given a dearth of refined outlets to meet.

The Cosmopolitan Lesbian Society is a Society of Leaders; whether CEOs, entrepreneurs, and businesswomen, or scientists, PhDs and doctors, we strive to challenge, sharpen, and inspire one another. We invite you to revel and luxuriate in, to be motivated and moved by, the company of lovely lesbians in our elegant and chic settings. 

Mind you: this is not a ‘league.’ Nor a ‘club.’ Neither is it an organization. And certainly -- not a ‘group.’ It is nothing less than a Society of smart, classy Women. 

The Society becomes official on 1 January, 2016, when its A-round of Funding closes. (Feel free to follow up with me to inquire how the capital will be spent in fiscal 2016.) After this date, the Society will permit members by interview and on a dues-paying basis only. At that point, women must be nominated to interview.

And please, mark our event on Saturday, November 7th, in your diary as one to reminisce in years to come as ‘oh that night…’ with "ahh, those Women" 

The Society's activities will include: 

• museum openings + cocktails

• guest speakers including diplomats, educators, entrepreneurs, actors, authors, philanthropists, and artists

• private cocktail parties and dinners hosted at fabulous restaurants/bars

• movie pre-screenings

• book discussions featuring the authors

• sports events (i.e. bootcamps, private classes at boutique studios like SoulCycle or Barry's Bootcamp, etc)

• small dinner parties 

• summer house rental

• winter ski house rental

• Caribbean trip 

• two long international trips each year - i.e. safari, Asia, etc.  

• More activities - per your recommendations - will be added 

<br>

Please feel free to contact Andrea@CLSociety.com with ideas or questions.  

Twitter: CosLesSociety
Instagram: CosLesSociety
results.name: Cosmopolitan Lesbian Society: Smart & Sophisticated

NYC is a first mover in combining the power of technology and the voice of the people to affect changes that matter. And yet as public policy wonks in startup alley, we were surprised by the lack of active conversation about the intersection of public policy and technology. While New York City attempts to bring governance to the 21st century with initiatives like Open Data, why is there little chatter amongst the impacted constituents about these initiatives? ‘Let's change that’ we said, and hence the birth of this meetup series.



Interested in the cross-section between policy & technology? How is technology being utilized to make policy more accessible? Join us to learn about the current trends in technology utilization that are changing the way individuals interact with government information & services.

results.description:
https://youtu.be/lvHLCbcSSdg

Do you see yourself as a "thinker for world change?" 

Join a no-cost event that will give you a taste of this visionary networking experience! http://inspiredleadersacademy.com/inspired/lid-kickoff-b/

Maybe you work in an organization and have a burning concept you want to bring to market. Maybe you're an academic, eager to get on a TED stage; or a doctor, psychologist, coach or other expert wanting to showcase your expertise. Maybe you're already an entrepreneur--business or social--and have a new idea that could impact even greater change.

Have you ever truly found a networking group you enjoyed? One that was as different as you?

Almost all follow a tired formula of ho-hum speakers, forced, superficial encounters, a mismatch of attendee needs and interests, a focus on quantity, not depth--and (really) bad chicken.

I'm Lizabeth Phelps, founder of Inspired Leaders' Academy, and the entrepreneurs I work with are spurred every day by pretty big missions and these kinds of events leave them profoundly empty. 

That is why I have developed Leaders in Dialogue--Visionary Networking for World-Changing Thinkers.

It is for those who need a "new class" of networking experience that emphasizes *peer-to-peer* knowledge, cutting-edge discussion, future visioning, thought leadership and collaboration.

It is based on the discussion-type gatherings attended by the great philosophers and inventors of Europe's Age of Enlightenment, who succeeded in large part because of the discussion groups they attended.

Leaders in Dialogue tosses out the wearisome networking models of today and reaches back in time to a model that once changed the world--and is visionary enough for the NEW "age of enlightenment" that is upon us now.

Become a dues-based member and you become part of an "alliance"--a brother/sisterhood, really--where your business connections are made from deep interaction. 

Nothing is superficial here! The benefits are numerous, and unlike anything offered by conventional models.

To register for a free event where you can sample this new group, go here:  http://inspiredleadersacademy.com/inspired/lid-kickoff-b/
results.name: "Leaders In Dialogue" Entrepreneurial Networking

results.description: This is a group for working professionals, living in NYC, with families to protect. This is not for the people with a hardcore doomsday survivalist mentality. I'm preparing a self-sufficient community where all essential goods and services will be available if there happens to be a system shutdown. I need to recruit professionals with important skills and then build the first bug-out locations in Queens and Brooklyn (this is a place where we can easily travel to, rather than running into the woods with a tent). Instead of staying at a public shelter, this will be a place where we can all stay safe during a crisis with people we know and trust. Given the number of people joining this group, I will decide whether to expand to more locations. So spread the word! Let's live happily and comfortably during times of crisis.

results.description:
I know that this site is mostly for 'activity-buds' ---- the kind of people with whom you share some hobbies, sporadic time commitments, and the kind of light conversation that will never delve into real intimacy. That's not what I'm looking for. And damn the preposition that brought me to this point. 

I have been out-of-college for nearly a decade and my closest friends are not in the city or even the state. I have also never had the pleasure of a group of friends and am nurturing some beautiful independent relationships where it increasingly feels like we're always just "catching up" instead of being an active part of each other's lives. I'm also tired of accepting the dooming wisdom that adults CAN'T make friends.

I want to go to bars with you (dear group of friends) and laugh until we're blue, discover new exhibits, have dinner parties, go to each other's weddings, go to hockey games, concerts, and make this friendship real. I know this is even odder than dating online but once we find each other, I'm sure we can come up with a better meet-cute group story. 

About me: Late 20's, New Yorker, brassy, works at a start-up, thinks she's funny, routinely inappropriate, struggling to even START Infinite Jest, and would dominate pop-culture questions in pub trivia. I'm too lazy to be 'basic' but am not ashamed of liking Pumpkin Spice Lattes and top 40's.

About you? Do tell.
results.name: Idealistic cynics forming a montage-worthy group of friends

results.description:
Hello Everyone,

The organizer for this meetup is an artist and academic working on a project that looks at how space is organized in New York City. The sights here reflect the ideas for balanced global operation. Looking at the iconic sights that characterize NY, while talking about what they mean, we uncover aspects of our nature as individuals and our future as a global culture.

To see and experience these dynamics we look at art in the public spaces of this city. By placing it in its cultural context we reveal or reassert  the mental structure for a global citizenry.

Each of the places visited will reveal fresh perspectives. We will organize to meet in different neighborhoods and institutions that have creative works on display. Join this community and renew your love for this city all while relating to amazing people with similar interests.

Together we will develop a more profound appreciation for this incredible city beyond all limits.

Your guide is a licensed professional and studies meaning in the things we create.
results.name: Global Citizenship in New York City

results.description:
**PSA: New members please fill out our new member form so we can better help you reach your hunting goals. **

Who we are

Hunters and sportsmen/women who are interested in learning how to begin to hunt big game (Bear, Elk, Deer, Bobcat) as well as many species of migratory waterfowl (Teal, Goose, Wood duck, Pintail, Black SeaDuck etc) and upland bird (Pheasant, Dove, Quail). Lots of planning and work goes into learning how to successfully hunt for your own meat and what that means for the broader environment.

Find us on Twitter @nychunting

What we do

We have three different types of meetups here.

1) Hunting knowledge meetups

2) Sport shooting and practice meetups (Trap, Skeet) (List of surrounding facilities)

3)Hunting Meetups and Mentorship

Navigating hunting can be difficult especially if you come from a family that has never hunted! This group is for beginners and experts alike looking to create community. Long traditions have been passed down from hunting families and we'd love to share all the information we've learned together. Join if one of these types of events appeals to you and you want to be part of an awesome community!


P.S. -> Payment Links

Changetip // Paypal // Venmo

Bitcoin: 14wC9TygXkEXXjm6xVneJHvUa8eUrfEHM3


If you feel so inclined a dollar here or two doesn't hurt. Meetup charges our group $180/year for hosting (Unfortunately Meetup is not free for organizers) :). If we add value to your life consider joining financially as well.


Topics to be covered from different speakers in the community and different events: 

Hunting organizations to get involved with 

Conservancy and regulation 

Orienteering

Hunting and Technology 

Topography and GIS 

How to use a Compass 

Orienteering 

Ruts 

Seasonal behavior of individual species 

Regulations - Federal, State, City 

Where do I keep my firearms? 

How do I buy a firearm? What about a scope? 

How do I take care of my firearms? 

Physical conditioning for big game hunts 

Public vs Private Land Ownership, what that means for the hunter Harvesting your kills (Various species) - field dressing, butchering, aging, packing, cooking (Field to table) and many, many more topics to come......

results.description:
The New York Tennis Meetup Group is a platform for tennis lovers to convene, to organize games and matches, to promote the sport of tennis, and most importantly, to have fun. We welcome all levels of players from beginners to professional coaches to join us and serve each other.

To facilitate event organizing, please observe the following guidelines:

All members must post a face recognizable picture on the profile page.
Anyone can request to be an Event Organizer (EO) as long as he/she has been active with the group. While being "active" is subjective, I would say a good attendance of 20+ without "no-show" is a good indication.
As EO, one would reserve the court, post and host the event. He can also place all RSVP on wait list from which the EO would pick out the final tennists before the event date.
As a courtesy to the EO and members on waiting list, please change RSVP well in advance. The general rule of thumb is at least 2 days before the event.
EO should post a self rating range on the event base on NTRP system, e.g. 1.5 - 2.5 for members to consider before RSVP.
EO determine cost but it must be posted on the event in advance. For amateur players, we suggest sharing the court fee and cost of new balls. To cover some intangible expenses, EO can have the liberty to charge higher than cost.
From time to time, the group shall organize free coaching session exclusively for the EOs.
Members' record showing frequent no show without cancelling will be removed from the group. Late cancellations are considered as no show. Please make sure all players who show up checkin to the meetup system.
Professional Coaches are welcomed to join us. Once recognized by the group organizer as a Meetup Coach, one can organize events just like any other EO and charge their own rate.
From time to time, the Group would organize community tennis event free to new comers in different district to promote the game. Professionals can take advantage of such events to promote their services.
If you haven’t notice, we call ourselves Tennist and our Headline is “Come serve with Tennis Meetup!”
Disclaimer: New York Tennis Meetup is an amateur platform that welcomes all tennis players. By joining our events, all participants are deemed to have agreed to the terms and conditions contained in this disclaimer, and agreed to exonerate the organizers and any other participants in the games from any liabilities, claims, including but not limited to liabilities and claims as a result of any injuries or deaths or damages arising thereof. Players joining games are at their own choosing and at their own risk.
results.name: New York Tennis Meetup Group

topics.name: Practical Application of A Course in Miracles

results.description:
Channeled by the same voice that authored A Course in Miracles but in more easy to understand and perhaps more feminine language, Mari Perron's A COURSE OF LOVE speaks to the heart rather than the mind. Let's explore this important new text together from the beginning and use it as a springboard to become peaceful miracle workers. Led by CRS co-founders and ACIM Teachers/Healers Yasuko Kasaki and Christopher Pelham, this class will begin at the beginning of the book and work its way through the text week by week. 

It may be astonishing to hear that there is a “continuation” of A Course in Miracles, but it is true. Forty years ago Jesus dictated ACIM to the scribe Helen Schucman. More recently, over three years, he similarly dictated A Course of Love. Jesus himself referred to what he was dictating as a “continuation of A Course in Miracles.” Students of ACIM will recognize the Voice. Students of truth, whatever their background, will find that ACOL resonates with the heart. 

A COURSE OF LOVE builds upon the same non-dualistic thought system as ACIM, yet it is a course for the heart. ACOL and ACIM work hand-in-hand. Yet remarkably, ACOL bypasses the mind. It uses thought to go beyond thought. Those yearning to access the heart’s knowing will find help here. This is your invitation to live the purposeful, meaningful life of the new—the reality of heaven on earth. 

Classes are $20 and class cards are available. Students of all experience levels and backgrounds are welcome! 

Yasuko Kasaki has been teaching A Course in Miracles and offering spiritual counseling and healing since 1999. She has approximately 1,000 students and clients. In 2004, she opened CRS, the first and only spiritual center in New York City devoted to the study and practice of ACIM. Ms. Kasaki is the author of 21 books published by major publishers in Japan.

You can listen to a sampling of Yasuko's recent guided meditations here: http://crsny.podbean.com

Christopher Pelham currently serves as teaching assistant for the Monday ACIM class and will sometimes lead the group when Ms. Kasaki is away. He is the Director and a co-founder of CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing). He produces arts/cultural/educational events at the Center, leads Inner Vision Workouts, and works as a CRS Healer and teacher of A Course in Miracles. In addition to studying ACIM with Yasuko Kasaki since 2003, he studied the Spiritual Psychology of Acting with London-based teacher John Osborne Hughes and Keith Johnstone-based Improvisation with the late Gloria Maddox.

Another great way to get a taste of our approach is to attend one of our free Healing meetups, each of which is open to the public: 

Spiritual Healing Clinic Mondays & Tuesdays 7 – 7:40 pm
suggested donation $20, nobody turned away
Guided Meditation Tuesdays 6:30 – 7 pm Free!
results.name: A Course of Love Study Group NYC

We are a Qigong group, practicing Zhineng Qigong. All levels are welcome to practice and share experiences.

Our locations are Greenpoint Brooklyn & Manhattan.

Meeting cost is a nominal $5


Zhineng Qigong was started by Dr Pang in China. Please google Zhineng Qigong and Dr Pang. It is an open system, Dr Pang was a prolific writer and researcher.

With the practice of Zhineng Qigong, we remove internal blocks, restore physical health and emotions, and build Extraordinary capabilities.

We divide our meeting in two portions. One hour of practice of level 1 exercises, LQU (Lift Qi Up) and 3CM (Three Centers Merge). For the second hour, we usually invite high level teachers/masters from around the world to give a presentation via Skype. We feel it inspires our practice and introduces us to different teaching styles.

All the masters we invite are former students of Dr Pang and are internationally acclaimed. Most have written books on ZNQG, which are available via Amazon.

So far the following teachers have appeared via Skype

master Jianshe from China

http://www.hexju.com/

teacher Hou Hee (Frank) Chan from California

http://www.chilel.com/chilel.html

teacher Ooi Kean Hin from Malaysia

https://qigongzhineng.wordpress.com/about/

master Liu from China

http://www.lifeqicenter.com/Teachers.html

<br>

results.description:
Let's play some golf together! We are a smallish sized group that enjoys playing together once every week or two at the local public golf courses. Please note that this is NOT a singles meetup type of event. It's for people who enjoy playing golf and enjoy it that much more when playing with a compatible group.  


My ideal is to have eight people (for two foursomes) for each outing. At this point, we have a core of 3 to 4 people who show up most of the time. Others have then joined in a meetup just on occasion. That's all fine. Playing with new(ish) members of the group is part of what makes it fun. As space permits, bring along a friend to play if that helps round out getting two full foursomes.


Although I'm mostly thinking of a group of guys playing golf, I don't want to be exclusionary. Women would be welcome. So far this summer a couple of women have played. Last summer no women played golf with our group. Hey, whatever.


If you can say "yes" to most of these questions then you would be pretty compatible with the group: 

1. You're a young senior. ... For myself I'm 62. But ages in the group range.

2. You're available during weekdays to play. ... Wanted so we can get cheaper rates. Being retired or semi-retired helps.

3. You're nearby (within 7 or so miles of Cranford). ... This ties in with keeping the group small. 

4. You play in the area. ... As for me, I normally play at these public courses: Hyatt Hills, Ashbrook, & Galloping Hill.  We also play at some courses farther afield (like the Rutgers golf course) and have had fun with it. From a survey of the group most members want a variety in the courses we play and are also up for higher end courses on occasion. 

5. You can ALREADY play golf. ... You can be somewhat poor, average, or quite good. ... My own handicap is a 26 (on the weak side, but seriously hope to improve). ... Note: Let me add that in joining this group you pretty much need to be able to break 100 at least on occasion (my definition of "somewhat poor"). BUT if you can keep up your pace of play this can offset playing poorly. ... Frankly, at this writing we are trying to determine what works best. I want to be inclusive (especially given that I don't always break 100 myself). But then it can be frustrating for some of the better golfers if they have to deal with slow play. So if you don't play reasonably well you need to be sure you can keep up your pace of play so that you don't hold up everyone else.

6. You follow good golf etiquette. ... You know and follow the rules. But if you need a mulligan please take it.  And to keep up our pace of play  again we follow "ready golf". That means you don't need to wait for the farthest away to hit first if you're ready to hit.

7. Good attitude. ... Even if your game is going poorly you enjoy being out and can joke around with others. 'Nuff said? I think so. 


We also sometimes try to add some competition to add to the fun of playing. One thing we've done at times is to use match play with two person teams. Each team takes their best score for each hole and tries to beat the other team(s) best score on a hold-by-hole basis. You can of course still keep your own personal score.

So let's keep it simple and fun. See you on the course!
results.name: Cranford Social Golf Club Meetup -- for Young Seniors

results.description: Linking with others in New York and around the world to aid the planetary shift in consciousness. The full moon meetings include a talk on themes related to the energies coloring the particular constellation under consideration, while the meetings at the new moon consist of group discussion related to the various crises confronting our world as we transition into a new age. Each meeting concludes with a group meditation through which we serve through the contacting, holding and distribution of the contacted energy to all life forms. The moments of the full and new moons each month provide the greatest opportunity for us to pause and align ourselves with the soul and, in turn, with the planetary heart center, the Spiritual Hierarchy. Through such means we cooperate with the Divine Plan or Intention for our world. Today, countless groups, large and small, meet regularly throughout the world at these interlude periods in the cycles of nature. These groups have been meeting for decades, so the work does not start anew each month but rather builds and grows upon a well-established foundation, a living nucleus of spiritual energy from which we take and to which we give. This work demands of us at all times a deepened understanding and an increased ability to penetrate to new levels of consciousness so lifting humanity as a whole. http://www.lucistrust.org/en/service_activities/start_a_meditation_group/resource_center

results.description:
The basic idea: 

• You work in tech. 

• You're in the NYC area. 

• You care about "people" issues. 

• You think the hardest problem in computing is "people". 

• You are interested in how we work; how to structure work; how to work together; how to help your colleagues succeed. 

And... There's so much to learn: 

There's a ton of books out there to get good ideas from. Too many in fact. You'll never get through them all. So, don't. Distribute the learning. 

What a meeting is like: 

We all read different "people" books. We get together every month and 2 people each present a book or a concept from a book. Their presentation can be up to 20 minutes long and then, we talk about the concepts from the presentation for a while.

We limit ourselves to 2 presentations per meetup. Each presentation can be up to 20 minutes long with an additional discussion period that can also be up to 20 minutes long. Presentations can be a general overview of a book, a discussion of a specific topic from a book or a synthesis of ideas from across a number of books.

We keep our meetings small 10-14 people max so if you RSVP and later find that you can't attend, please cancel as soon as possible. Priority for signup to any given meeting is given to attendees of the previous meeting. 

Interested in presenting?

Get some inspiration from our "books on interest" list and our list of past presentations. If you see a book you would like to present from on the past presentations list, fret not, reach out to the organizers, its quite possible that if you want to focus on a specific topic that its still available for a deeper dive.

Once you've decided on a book, message an organizer and we can work out the details.

Code of Conduct:

The Tech "People" Bookclub is dedicated to a harassment-free experience for everyone. Our anti-harassment policy can be found at: http://www.meetup.com/the-tech-people-bookclub/pages/Code_of_Conduct/
results.name: The Tech "People" Bookclub

results.description:
Who's Got Next in HR (WGNinHR) is for the tired, the bold, the innovative and ambitious HR professional. It's a Movement born out of a weariness with the status quo that puts HR leaders and doers in a box. WGNinHR is busting us out of those boxes, and breaking all paradigms. It's for those who dare to ask 'what's next?', expecting to be challenged to new levels in HR - or even outside of it...to the C-Suite and perhaps, eventually, to the top seat. After launching as a (virtual) membership organization (www.wgninhr.org), WGNinHR is now ready to establish a NY presence. If you'd like to meet like-minded HR pros looking for creative ways to advance their careers, join this growing Movement - and become a part of our Meetup.  The Meetups will include networking, light refreshments and interactive learning opportunities!

What’s in a Name?

On playgrounds across the nation, and maybe even the globe, someone is screaming out a familiar question – ‘who’s got next?!’  The question is asked of the person confident enough to step onto the court or playground, grab the ball – and then do something amazing with it.  That’s where the name for this organization came from.  Its focus is on the HR professional who dares to not only ask the ‘what’s next?’ question, but to shape the answer!

This is a Movement looking to challenge your thinking, and that of the folks who surround you who may be suffocating your career aspirations, perhaps unintentionally. The fact is, too many HR pros are convinced that they can’t aspire to more – in their fields, outside their fields, to the C-Suite and even to the CEO seat. 

This Meetup is for you.  Whether you’re the aspiring HR pro having just graduated and in your first HR gig, or the more seasoned among us with 20+ years of HR and business experience.  This is for you if you truly believe that there’s more to your career story. 

NY Trailblazers

The goal is a monthly meetup like no other.  Yes, there will be networking which is awesome. Yes, there will be refreshments to give us the energy boost at the end of a day.  But, we’ll strive for even more.  Creativity.  Innovation.  New – and quirky – thinking about old issues and hot topics which impact HR leaders aspiring for more.  Interactive learning sessions will serve as incubators for ideas that may ultimately position HR leaders as the smartest people in the room….whether it’s the conference room or the board room.

Want to Join?

If this group resonates with you, we’d love to have you! But we ask that you engage wholly and completely.  When you RSVP, keep your commitment and show up.  If you can’t, just let the organizer know at least a couple of days in advance whenever possible.  If you volunteer in this powerful Movement, it means that your colleagues are one step closer to reaching new levels because of your efforts.  We don’t take that lightly and ask that you don’t either.  The world of business needs you and we believe that your life will never again be the same as you connect with like-minded others.

Who’s Got Next?


Contact Jo Rencher at: wgninhr@optonline.net


*Stay tuned for our first Meetup Date and Location!
results.name: Who's Got Next in HR? - NY Trailblazers

results.description:
Yoga (not physical Yoga but that of consciousness) may be defined as a process of conscious participation in the growth of one's consciousness.
When reading a philosophy such as The Gita, it is sometimes natural to the mind to make a delineation between the "teaching" and "real life". For example, one may read the Gita and understand it but not apply it in their corporate job. Aurobindo Ghosh, an Indian philosopher and poet said "All Life is Yoga". In This group we will explore this idea further and look for ways to apply The Gita as well as some ideas of Integral Yoga to life.

This group has the following goals:

• To explore how philosophies such as The Gita and works of Aurobindo Ghosh's Integral Yoga may be applied to routine life to give our activities a deeper meaning.

• To challenge the belief that human nature cannot change and explore how Yoga can be used not only to affect change in one's own nature (for the better) but use this change as a means of personal transformation.

• To read and explore The Gita and the literature of Aurobindo Ghosh's Integral Yoga

Instragram Page
results.name: Gita and Integral Yoga NYC - A Practical Approach

results.description:
Have you ever walked into a gallery, barfed up your dinner, only to realize what is now splashed across the floor is of a higher aesthetic order than that which hangs on the wall? Unfortunately too many galleries are in the biz of hawking art rather than cultivating it. If possible they would frame up the remains of your recently purged spaghetti bolognese before selling it back to you, pitching its 'importance' in the sophomoric language of art-speak. Well Gotham is home to innumerable talented artists whose works go unrecognized by these self-appointed arbiters of art. And guess what folks? Throughout the year they welcome the public into their creative lairs during NYC's numerous open studio festivals. By joining TOAS (not to be confused with 'toas'- the  small painted artifacts of Australia's indigenous Diyari speaking people, see image below)

you will you get to meet artists, discuss their works, and hang out with a fun group of art lovers just like yourself. Better yet, should you buy a piece of art 100% of the proceeds go directly to the artist not some euro-trash salesman in a three size too small Armani suit. So check back frequently for the latest open studio event.
results.name: THE OPEN ARTIST STUDIOS

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's (We are located 1 room over from the pool tables).  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Codenames, Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark

results.description:
Most Sundays, at 11am

This is a new type of philosophy meetup, and I am a new type of moderator. I am calling this conclave Voki-all-joyo. Each week, on Sunday morning, we will meet for a presentation, discussion, and sharing of ideas. These ideas are meant to be about the issues most important to your heart:
 •  Why are you here?
 •  What should you believe?
 •  What should you learn?
 •  How do you succeed?
 •   What should you being doing to make the world better?
 •  How can you be happy(ier)?

This is not about doctrine, dogma, or definiteness. This is about dialectics, discourse, and discussion.

Each week a topic or theme will be presented around ideas or thoughts from the realms of science, western philosophy, eastern philosophy, and literature. I draw on the world of many great western minds, including: Thoreau, Kant, Einstein, Chomsky, Sun Tzu, Epictetus, Jung, Aquinas, Fromm, James..… and as a Sanskrit theorist I draw on many of the ancient Vedic texts, the Mahabharata, The Bhāgavata Purāṇa, the Upanishads, The Bengali poets and scholars, and many others.

Many of the topics will be about yoga, science, meditation, philosophy, and basically all things that can be used to help us explore how to both think more clearly and at the same time reside happily in the cloud of unknowing.

Each week I will offer a presentation about the topic that is no more than 17 minutes long. We will then have a discussion on the topic, and sharing time. 

So, remember to bring something that inspires you to share. It can be a piece of music, a photo, a poem, or even a short anecdote. 

I will close the session with some brief remarks, and then go to brunch, or, if the weather is nice, on a picnic. I hope you will join me ☺

About your host

My name is Atma. I speak four languages and can read and write Sanskrit. I am a behavioral scientist with a background in educational psychology. I am spiritual, but not religious. I am agnostic, but not atheistic. I am rational, but not close-minded. I am here to be of service to others. I like art, history, science, music, literature, and things that buzz or blink. I think coming together as a community on Sunday mornings has value, but I’m not into church. I want to grow and learn in the company of my peers, and friends, free from the dictates of dogma and blue hair.

Therefore, I have created Voki-all-joyo (phonetic for voki al ĝojo.) This is Esperanto (one of my favorite languages) for Call to Joy. I named it this because I am convinced that our constitutional position as spirits in a human form is to be full of joy. I aIso feel strongly that clear thinking is the best path to real joy. Please note, when I say, ‘be full of joy’, I do not mean joy in some horribly homogeneous way, like a narcotized, monolithically emotional state. I mean joy, as in a rich state of appreciation and wonder at the mystery and beauty of life. (Like the feeling you get when you find a box of Twinkies in a post-apocalyptic zombie wasteland.)

So, think of this as a pasta sea of fellow swimmers who are looking for what binds us together without being bound up by the ligaments of human speculation. Since perhaps, it is not so wise to hold dear that which is so dearly held by those who prefer not think for themselves:)

Think clearly and be grateful
(Pensi klare kaj esti dankema)

Atma

Our club greeting:
~ Ne estu schmuckie (Don’t be a schmuck)

~ Vi nek (You either)

This is a great way to make some friends if you are a first time mom without friends with kids and if you are new and would like to meet other expecting mothers.

topics.name: Before and After Weight Loss Surgery

results.description: This group is for anyone who would like to share their experiences after weight loss surgery (lap band, sleeve, by pass). No medical advice. Just support on the use of your tool. Sharing tips, recipes, strategies to help you cope.

results.description: This is a group for LGBTQ Alternative Healthcare professionals. Let's get together and discuss our cases, modalities, challenges, and triumphs. My idea is to have monthly informal meetings that might be centered on our individual modality, specific health care issues and how we handle them, issues of self care and burnout in the healthcare community, interfacing with the mainstream medical world, business models, etc. Or anything else that interests us! I'm looking to create a rich, supportive forum in a gay-friendly environment. All genders and orientations within that are very welcome!

results.description: NY Social Tennis Meetup is a group for anyone interested in Tennis. Our goal is to connect tennis players to fun and competitive match play of all levels. Whether you are a beginner or advanced player, there is something for everyone. Looking forward to meeting tennis enthusiasts soon!

results.description:
3D Roundhouse is very pleased to offer our Family 3D Printing Workshops in New York City!
We share a simple belief: Families will enjoy making things together, using 3D printing technology. Bring your family to our workshops and we will teach you how you and your children can make amazing things together using 3D software for 3D Printing.

results.description: This is a life sculpting group with a live model at the American Woodcarving school in Wayne. The model poses for 10 weeks in the same pose on Wednesday nights from 7 to 10. It is a free form class, you can come for all 10 weeks or just a few. All skill levels are welcome, we have had people that have never sculpted before. I provide instruction and technical advice to those that want it. You can bring your own sculpting supplies, or we have supplies available for purchase. $40 dollars for a session.

results.description: Events throughout the year showcasing all aspects of chinese history, language, culture, art and business. Join us to explore, learn, experience, connect, make new friends, socialize, taste and have fun!
results.name: Experience China at China Institute

results.description: This group is for anyone using, or interested in using Axure RP, an interactive prototyping tool. This is an opportunity to come together and share knowledge, regardless of skill level. Axure allows you to create prototypes without coding, with varying levels of fidelity. The output can be something very basic that works in a browser, or a fully functional, more complex prototype that passes variables and uses conditional logic. Please join us if you are curious!
results.name: Axure Meetup NYC

results.description: A group dedicated to this new era of filmmaking brought about by the new tools enabling cinematic virtual reality (CVR) experiences. As this group starts, we will highlight upcoming events related to CVR. As the tools become more accessible, we will begin producing CVR experiences ourselves.
results.name: Cinematic VR NYC

results.description:
Do your software projects stumble over the deployment hurdle? If so, you are not alone. Many software projects struggle to achieve consistent deployments across their environments—from Test to UAT to Staging to Production. Successful deployments must account for differences between environments; coordinate development teams and environment owners; balance schedule pressures; and create the requisite audit trail. When these challenges are compounded by error prone, inconsistent and inefficient manual processes, achieving a consistent deployment can seem impossible.

Join to learn more about DevOps best practices and network with professionals in the area.

DevOps Subject matter experts will present case studies and breakfast and lunch will be provided. 

This will be discussion based and we will discuss anything that the audience brings up!
results.name: New York DevOps Networking Meetup

topics.name: Where to Meet other TG People

results.description: Being TGNC and finding community is often difficult. If you identify as TGNC and live uptown (e.g., Washington Heights, Inwood, Riverdale) and would like to find a welcoming, authentic, safe space to find connection, please come give us try. The goal of this space is to build a community where trans* people can feel comfortable and connected as we cook, read, drink, engage culture, play, make music and anything else that suits your fancy. And please bring your partner, all those loved and important to you are welcome!
results.name: Uptown TGNC Community

results.description:
Welcome to Oh My Squad! Where we're allllll about the good times. 

Who should join:  <br>Fun and outgoing people who like to dwell in dark bars. You like meeting new people but not enough to join a sports team. New York newbies welcome. 

What we'll do:  <br>Brunches, happy hours, disco dancing, some shopping, concerts. Open to suggestions. 

*Inactive members will be removed.
results.name: Oh My Squad (Late 20's to early 30's)

results.description: There are so many great real estate investment, foreclosure and distressed properties seminars and meetings all over New York. Which one to go to? We will host events just for socializing and networking so we get to know one another, help each other with deal analysis, and even invest in each other's dreams and goals. In addition, our group will be one of the best places to learn about many other real estate investment gatherings and events in greater New York City area, so we can visit various sister Meetups as a group to help them, and yet, our highest priority will be our own monthly Meetup gathering in Manhattan. So you will learn about Flipping properties, short-sales, distressed real estate investing, REOs, Foreclosures, Auctions, Lease-Options and more. Please don't join if you don't truly want to meet others in person and contribute to their investing while benefiting from them as well. This will be an active meetup...
results.name: New York Real Estate Networking Meetup

results.description: Are you an investor? Do you believe in the power of education, business networking, learning, and above all, do you believe in the power of being among your positive-minded peers? Then, this group is for you! Most of our success in life comes from being a part of a peer group of people who dream big, and who expand their knowledge about investing and business success through networking and attending great events, workshops and seminars. It is hard to be isolated and to rely only in ourselves while a "right" peer group can push us to the next level of success in business, life and investing. Join us now if you live within 15 miles of NYC and want to meet your peer group in person!
results.name: NYC-Investors-Entrepreneurs

results.description: The Manhattan Women’s Club (MWC) is a private social group in New York City. As you might guess, it is made up primarily of women who live in the New York metropolitan area. But more important, its members are linked by their outlook (not their gender or location) and by a newly-coined but hard-to-describe trait called: “Manhattan-mindedness.” This has less to do with geography and more with the best and most common traits observed in MWC members: curiosity, intrepidness, intelligence, good-naturedness, generosity, savvy-ness, kindness, inclusiveness, worldliness – and a great sense of humor. “Manhattan Women” live all over the world. Yes, there IS bias here because MWC members are highly capable in the many roles they pursue – which include: chefs, friends, bankers, teachers, quilters, artists, lawyers, parents, authors, doctors, musicians, agents, philanthropists, spouses, entrepreneurs, professors, caterers, accountants, designers, producers, historians, actresses and grandparents. And probably a few Indian chiefs, too! The MWC “clubhouse” is New York City and its immediate environs because of the infinite variety, diversity and scope New York offers in terms of extraordinary things to see and do. We sometimes travel farther afield, always with a Manhattan-minded outlook. If you would like additional information about our group, go to our website: http://www.manhattanwomensclub.com
results.name: Manhattan Women's Club

topics.name: Bible Study in a Relaxed Atmosphere

results.description: An open forum for discussing Bible related topics. We are nondenominational. We are dedicated to understanding the Word of God with all the clarity and precision it deserves. Our hope is to be able to sort through all the misconceptions and false ideas we have all grown up with and come to a better understanding of the truth.
results.name: Bible Discussion Group NYC

results.description: The CreatorUp Video Crew Call is a chance for you to meet talented new crew like writers, editors, directors, producers, composers, musicians, art directors, production designers, actors, and cinematographers to help you shoot your awesome upcoming video projects, or to show off your skills and expertise as a crew or cast member to become a part of somebody else's video project that you love.

results.description: This is a group for the Adjunct Professors who work in the NYC area, non-permanent, part-time teaching staff in the area's colleges and universities. Let's meet each other, trade war stories, write together, and sort out what we want to do in Higher Education if anything at all.

results.description: This group is for business minded individuals looking to start their business or beginners; with an emphasis on making new friendships with the occasional fun times, workshops and more....

results.description: As the first ever meetup group worldwide on Adobe Experience Manager Forms (AEM Forms), the goal of this group is to provide a great platform for business stakeholders, analysts, and technical folks to learn more about the AEM Forms/LiveCycle product offerings, share real world experiences, and best practices. Topics will focus on how AEM Forms is different from Adobe LiveCycle ES, how to migrate from LiveCycle to AEM Forms, how to integrate with Adobe Analytics, Target and Adobe eSignature, developing adaptive forms, interactive/dynamic PDF forms, backend business process workflows, etc.

results.description: Homophobia is not a particularly exclusive club. As I discovered as a school kid, you don't even have to be attracted to guys to get in. Were you harassed and gay-bashed for behaving like a girl? Do you want to have our own voice to speak out about what it's like, to help protect kids like us from falling through the cracks if they don't identify as either gay or M2F trans? Want to organize for social-political activism about it?
results.name: OTHER Victims of Homophobia/Transphobia/Sissyphobia

results.description:
Movies are great, but there's nothing quite like the magic of live performers. Stand Up Comedy, Concerts, Theater, you name it!  Most people probably don't realize how many options there are for entertainment in/near their hometowns, or how many like-minded people there are right next door. 

If you're looking for something to do that's different than the usual fare, then this is the group to join. You'll discover actors, bands, comedians who are performing live in NJ.  The events you'll see here are perfect for date nights, girls night out, guys night out, etc..   If you're an audience member, you can meet performers you've maybe never heard of, and meet people who enjoy the same kinds of entertainment as you.  If you're a performer, you can see other peoples shows, and network with other artists.  Either way, it's a great way to open your mind up to new experiences and meet some new friends!

There are shows out there for all types and ages at venues across the NJ area. If you're interested in telling our group about your live show (in NJ) or a show you think other people would like, post it! This Meetup is all about connecting live performers and audiences with each other in every way.

Since this group will have Meetups of various types, there is no age limit or requirements to join.  Some Meetups might take place at locations that have age restrictions or alcohol, etc.

results.description: This meetup is focused on the Future of Data and the open community data projects governed by the Apache Software Foundation. Geared towards developers, data scientists and ALL Data enthusiasts who are building modern data applications. Our meetups cover all data -- data-in-motion and data-at-rest.  Meetups provide an opportunity to listen, share and work hands on with other technologists in the open source and open community Apache tools.

results.description: This group offers singles, dating, and relationship-building events that are fun, unique, safe, inclusive and otherwise special and memorable.

results.description: This is a group for black individuals who wants to support and invest in Black Entrepreneurs and Business Owners.  I am starting this group because there are many black individuals that want to invest in Black Entrepreneurs and Black Business Owners but they need the platform to allow them to do so.  Our job will be to bring individuals together, educate participants on the investment options, and build up capital to start our Investment Group.

topics.name: Exercise and Fun with our Beagles

results.description:
Calling all Upper West Side Beagle owners! This is is a meetup for all beagles of the UWS. We'll get together once a month at the park to hang out while our dogs run & play together. 

We are a group of friends, who all met in the neighborhood, and thought it would be a great idea to expand and meet more Upper West Side Beaglers. It is, after all, the best hood in NYC. Come join us!

More info:

Beagle: a small, sturdy hound of a breed having short legs, drooping ears, and a howl for a bark.

Beagler: person who owns a Beagle. 

UWS Beagler: person who owns a Beagle and lives on the Upper West Side!

results.description: We are people that love making our home the perfect place. New technology promises the home of the future but we want to see how much that aligns to our vision .  It is just a trend? It is worth spending hundreds of dollars in smart/connected devices? We will analyze, dissect maybe even break a different smart device every session. We will brainstorm and discuss about what are real uses and problems beyond what marketers tell us. Also, we will explore home sustainability, growing things in our patio/window with the aid of technology, solar energy options for Brooklyn apartments (it is even possible?).  We really want IOT to happen, bring it on. =)
results.name: Smart Home Workshop, Brooklyn

results.description:
Greetings,

Thank you for your interest in the Young Black Women of a Certain Sophistication Club (11). 

This group caters to a very small and select number of professional, educated, ambitious and sophisticated African American women between the age of 28-45 who are looking to meet other well-rounded women for solid friendships, thought provoking discussions, meetings, activities, travel, community service and social gatherings.

Our aim is to provide an intimate network for women who enjoy a variety of activities including, but not limited to:

• Wine and dinner

• Intellectual conversations

• Travel & Spa Getaways

• Live music

• Parenting talks

• Community service

• and much more

If you're looking for a group where you can unwind, get to know wonderful ladies and build a support network, this might be the group for you. The group is highly-selective.

Our events only take place once a month so please watch out for our invitations and communications and indicate your attendance. All members are expected to reply to the RSVP.

Thank you for your interest in our Club (11).

Things to consider before joining:

1.  If accepted, you will receive an email and/or message with temporary acceptance into the group, and further instruction.  Without response, in three days, you will be removed. 

2. Please note that many of our events will take place in Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, and North NJ. Having access to a car may be helpful.

3. This group will only accept a small and select group of women. 

4. There is an annual $20.00 membership fee that must be paid on your anniverasy date,.

Warm regard,

Jinelle C.
results.name: Young Black Women of a Certain Sophistication  Club (11)

results.description: Many people want to meet new people in their area. Riverdale is crowded with people but there are few social groups in the area. This group is for people in Riverdale and the surrounding Bronx and westchester areas who want to meet new friends and have more of a social connection.
results.name: Bronx and westchester social group

results.description:
A social support group for women who work in the creative field. Think writers, artists, photographers, designers, actors, dancers, singers, chefs and other jobs in the creative field. Lets get together to converse, share and collaborate over Eggs Benedict and two hour unlimited mimosas!

Each month, I'll organize a brunch for all us too meet (and possibly other kind of activities)! But you're all encouraged to meet outside the group if you connect with members. 

Also, if anyone would like to host brunches at their home that would be also great!

You must work in the creative field at some capacity to join the group. You must include a real photo of yourself and be over 21 to join the group.
results.name: Mimosa Vibes for Women Creatives

results.description: Wednesday night Indoor soccer/futsal meetup! RSVP online and pay at the door level of play is intermediate to advanced
results.name: Brooklyn Futsal/Indoor Soccer

results.description:
Hello,

Welcome to Living on the Upper East Side - Happy Hour and Brunch group.  I've been a resident of the Upper East side for a number of years, and I often find myself traveling out of my own neighborhood to meet up with friends all the time.  It would be nice for me to come home after work and go to a happy hour locally or get out of bed on the weekend and not have to spend time commuting to meet friends for brunch downtown or on the west side of town.  So I decided to create a group that caters to those of us between the age of 25-45 years of age who would like to get together for Happy Hours and Brunch events throughout the week and on the weekends.

Happy Hour and Brunch events will be the main types of get togethers we will host initially, but my hope is to expand by sharing events hosted by other UES groups as well.  This way you will have one place to find out about events, instead of having to join 50 meetup groups to keep on top of things on the UES.  If you are an organizer of another group, please contact me and I would love to place your event on our calendar.  My second goal is to set up potlucks, trips to other parts of the city and out of town, cooking classes, and other events to create a greater sense of community. 

As of April 1st 2016, look for all events in our calendar that say "Living on the Upper East Side - Happy Hour and Brunch(HH+B)" for get togethers that are hosted by our organizers.  Our group events will never be more than 15-20 people, which should allow for diversity in the types of people you will meet but an event wont be too large that you will get lost in the crowd.  We take your recommendations for favorite places in the area seriously, and hope to plan events based around your feedback.

We look forward to meeting you at one of our future events.


Living on the Upper East Side - Happy Hour and Brunch (HH+B)

S.A.W.


FAQ

Why have I been waiting so long to be accepted in to your group?

There could be a number of reasons.  You not being cool enough isn't one of them.  We generally keep the member count at 160 members.  So we have to remove an inactive member after 6 months to let you in, or a space must open up if a member voluntarily leaves the group.  We do not believe that 300-2000 member groups really serve their meetup audience well.
results.name: Living on the Upper East Side  - S.A.W.

results.description:
A meetup group for exploring the application of mindfulness, Buddhism and non-duality in daily life. We will engage in dialogue with George Pitagorsky.

Anyone with a meditation practice or contemplating one will fit right in. We will all share experiences and exchange notes, encouraging each other.
results.name: Dialogues with George Pitagorsky

results.description:
Join us and meet other fun people who love to travel and want to make new friends and explore New York City and the world together! ✈️🌎

We plan to host events and meet and greets for members to get to know each other through local excursions as well as group vacations about once a month or more! Also, we will co-ordinate group trips and activities from New York City to exotic destinations! So join us today! It's free and going to be a lot of fun!!

Looking forward to meeting everyone soon!
results.name: Golden Sun Vacations Travel Group (New York Chapter)

results.description:
TheConnectionMovement is committed to reviving human connection with ourselves and each other.  We are a growing community of over 100 regularly active participants and 1000+ members of the greater community that share a commitment to deeper connection and richer communication in our lives.

An oasis and playground for connection, TheConnectionMovement meets 6-10 times per month in New York City.  Our get-togethers include social experiments, social gatherings, a deep and powerful inter-relational meditation practice called "Circling", and "Connection Labs" (structured activities that flex and engage our empathy, playfulness, listening, self-expression, and vulnerabilty).  The foundational principles and tools we engage with are inspired by the teachings of NonViolent Communication, Circling Europe, The Circling Institute, Authentic World, Ken Wilber's Integral Practices, and Creative Drama.

Founded in 2012 by Dan Sieling and Amy Silverman under the original name "Authentic Relating NY", TheConnectionMovement is directed and facilitated by Amy Silverman.  www.AmySilverman.com
results.name: The Connection Movement

results.description:
Every year during the Awards season, if you are a voter for Oscars, SAG Award, WGA/PGA/DGA/BAFTA Award, etc, you probably would be bombarded with free screening invites. (Many of them even include Q&A with stars/director/writers. Such screenings will be featured on this site) And I can't be the only one who thought it would be fun to go there with multiple people, getting together after the movie and talk about what we just saw. (And maybe, you might meet someone new...) If that's what you have in mind, this meetup is for you.

Wouldn't it be nice to be able to see movies possibly with the likes of Daniel Day-Lewis, Sally Field, Matt Damon, Matthew McConaughey, Jessica Chastain, Steven Spielberg, Bill Murray, George Clooney, Kiera Knightly, Scarlett Johansson, Anne Hathaway, Robert DeNiro, Hillary Swank, Felicity Jones, etc and ask them questions directly in person afterwards? For all this for free? Or see all these Oscar contender films before everyone else has a chance to see them at all at some gorgeous and cushy private screening rooms (with no worries for bedbugs)? This is a privilege we have as voters (who are truly in this show business and really work there, not as a spectator) and that's the experience we will be able to share once you join this group, ultimately will lead us into our exclusive Oscars Viewing Party.

(I wish I could make the site more visible for non-members so that people can actually see what kind of movies we are offering. Unfortunately, the team of studio attorneys warned us that we are being watched - for understandable reason since we deal with many yet-to-be-released films and Q&A events with high profile celebrities - so I'll have to make it private until you join us once the award season gets underway. Sorry about that.)

Voters are entitled to one guest (note: guests do NOT need to be guild members) so the numbers can grow pretty quickly. However, in terms of joining this group, we need to limit to people in the 20s - 50s who are members of any of the following (required to be able to actually sign up for the screenings for free - Studios do check the membership card so please be honest. Otherwise, we wouldn't be able to help you): AMPAS, HFPA, BAFTA, SAG-AFTRA, DGA, PGA, WGA and others. (If you do not know the meaning of ANY of these abbreviations, then most likely, you cannot join this group. Sorry... UNLESS you have a referral from an existing member or you have a close friend who is a voting member who can help you get in)
results.name: NY Exclusive Academy/Guild Voter Screening Meetup 2015-2016

results.description:
Why study the Enneagram?

Studying the Enneagram deeply is a spiritual approach to understanding each personality type as a hidden gift.  It can be a tool to help us become more “mindful” and teach us how to become more compassionate, forgiving, and accepting of others by first gaining a deeper, more compassionate understanding our own personality.

The modern day Enneagram (Greek for “9-diagram”) has been presented by many as a simple study of Personality Types for some forty years now. Indeed people around the world have used it as a tool similar to the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator as a way to better understand ourselves and improve our corporate success as well as our personal relationships. While this is certainly true there is so much more to gain from engaging the Enneagram on a deeper level.

Please join us! Even if you are new to this topic you are most welcome! Our mission is to listen and learn from one another in a safe and supportive setting. Ultimately we hope to discern how best to use this system to not only better our own lives but also the lives of everyone we touch. 

For more information on the Enneagram go to https://www.enneagraminstitute.com/
results.name: Upper West Side Enneagram Meetup

results.description:
Longing for intimate community and a return to the sacred? 

Hungry for deeper more meaningful conversation? 

Desire a place to be seen, validated and supported? 

We are tribe of conscious evolving women who come together in a sacred circle of support to authentically connect, play and be nourished through an exploration of the feminine in order to expand ourselves and our work on the planet. 

This will be a safe place for wisdom sharing and discussion. We will engage in practices to embody and connect you with your feminine essence. There will be exercises and rituals to play with in sacred circle. As our community grows you will meet like-minded women and friends who hold the same values and seek ways to live a fulfilled and meaningful life. 

The ideal member is the woman who is looking for connection with other women who wants to explore her spiritual and feminine sides and longs to come home to her true self.

results.description: Ever been to rock shows on your own? Just because you don't know anyone who loves rock music as you do? Felt like no one understands your appreciation or love for rock? Well why not meet and start sharing your taste for the music with people who will be at a concert for the same purposes as you, which is to have a great time listening to awesome bands!? Here's a chance to breaking that habit of showing up alone and feeling weird about it!

results.description: The Million Mom Movement is part of a global initiative to help revamp our food system. It's a forum of conversation, education, advice, recipes, and more. We share ideas of improving our families nutrition and awareness of the state of our Standard American Diet (SAD) and the dangers of GMO's and how we can work together for big changes. We are advocates to improve and label our GMO foods and for sound nutritional information. We are looking for dynamic women who want to promote a healthier lifestyle and want to help empower others.

results.description: The Junior League of Elizabeth-Plainfield is an organization of women committed to promoting voluntarism, developing the potential of women, improving the community through effective action, leadership of trained volunteers and providing a forum to meet and interact with others interested in making their community a better place. The JLEP operates and manages three projects; Career Closet, which provided FREE business wear to women re-entering the workforce, Teen Closet, which provided one on one college and resume services to in need high school seniors and the Jumble Store of Cranford, NJ. For more information on our community service projects or to help visit our website at www.jlepnj.org or email information@jlepnj.org.

results.description:
Join us for the second year of Music at the Museum, a monthly weekend concert series featuring classical and jazz musicians from the faculty of the Mason Gross School of the Arts Extension Division. These concerts take place at the Zimmerli and allow visitors to enjoy art and music side-by-side. Each concert is preceded by a master class or workshop related to the performance theme. Pre-concert forums and concerts are organized to present a broad repertoire accessible to audiences of all ages. 

This year starts off with Russian Masterpieces, a program solely devoted to music by Russian composers. The pre-concert forum will be presented by pianist Yevgeny Morozov and flautist Amy Tu, with performances by Yevgeny Morozov, Amy Tu, Anna Vasilyeva Shagun (piano), and Hyeri Choi (violin).

Music at the Museum performances are FREE to the general public, but seating is limited.
results.name: Music at the Museum Series: Russian Masterpieces

results.description: HER NYC focuses on the various identities that exist within the word HER. We know that women are beyond socially constructed stereotypes. HER story is the focus of this evening.
results.name: Entrepreneurship Stories powered by HERNYC

results.description: Save “The Date” A Dating Workshop- Finding True LOVE Online or Offline Are you more likely to find ‘The One’ online or offline? Is social media bringing you closer together as a couple or tearing you apart? What impact is technology having on your relationship? The Save “The Date” workshop explores all of the above and more. Please come with an open heart and an open mind. Finally connect to the truth about the success of online dating, texting, social media and LOVE. Mikka Onita, the founder of Club Millennial, LLC will host a guided discussion where you will have the opportunity to share stories and compare your experiences with newfound data. Couples therapist, Jan Summers will explain the psychological impact technology can have on loving, committed relationships. According to statistics, 40 million Americans are online daters. How does your personal life compare? Are you more connected in your relationship due to texting, email and social media or could you turn on your love life by turning off your phone? Come prepared to download the truth. Exclusive registration. Limited availability. Register today.
results.name: A Dating Workshop-Finding True Love Online or Offline

results.description:
A few friends and I are trying to get this great Catholic Club off the ground. We want to create a space where Catholic women can have fun, hang out, but also take something more substantial away from our events/get-togethers, to bring back to our families too (to enrich our home life). For this we are offering under the Club many wonderful activities that help to socialize among catholic woman but also grow in knowledge of the faith and how to make it happen in our ordinary family lives.

To find more information about events, calendar etc please visit http://www.yourcatholicmothersclub.com

results.description:
S.I.P. Your Way to Wealth™ comes from the wealth principles of Saving, Investing and Protecting. The S.I.P. Your Way to Wealth™ networking event is a quarterly 3-hour event calling all aspiring financially savvy professionals and entrepreneurs that are looking to be in a place of like minds and opportunity. 

The intention is to increase financial literacy and form a community of people that are looking for and/or may have investment opportunities and allowing them to connect. We all know the famous saying “It’s not what you know but who you know!” but I’m also a believer in “Teach Me How to Fish” so other than networking, there will be Keynote Speakers that will speak on a topic from their expertise. So be sure to have your smart devices charged and ready or just the old fashion way, pen and a notebook is good. 

What I know for sure is that it’s all in the KNOW ... So why not do so while SIP-ping on a nice glass of Wine, a Cocktail or some Tea!!! I can’t wait to meet you and S.I.P. Our Way to Wealth together. Wealthy people roll together and grow together I’ll see you at the top.

results.description:
Do you see yourself as a "thinker for world change?" A thought leader?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lvHLCbcSSdg

Join a no-cost event that will give you a taste of this visionary networking experience! http://inspiredleadersacademy.com/inspired/lid-kickoff-b/ 

 Maybe you work in an organization and have a burning concept you want to bring to market. 

Maybe you're an academic, eager to get on a TED stage; or a doctor, psychologist, coach or other expert wanting to showcase your expertise. 

Maybe you're already an entrepreneur--business or social--and have a new idea that could impact even greater change. 

I'm Lizabeth Phelps, founder of Inspired Leaders' Academy, and the entrepreneurs I work with are spurred every day by pretty big missions; the networking opportunities available to them leave them (and me) feeling empty. 

So, I've created a "new class" of networking experience that emphasizes *peer-to-peer* knowledge, cutting-edge discussion, future visioning, thought leadership and collaboration. 

It is based on the discussion-type gatherings attended by the great philosophers and inventors of Europe's Age of Enlightenment, who succeeded in large part because of the discussion groups they attended.

 Become a dues-based member and you become part of an "alliance"--a brother/sisterhood, really--where your business connections are made from deep interaction. 

 To register for a free event where you can sample this new group, go here: http://inspiredleadersacademy.com/inspired/lid-kickoff-b/
results.name: Northern New Jersey's Thought Leaders Group

results.description:
ADULT BASKETBALL CARDIO 


This program is for adults who love to play basketball at any skill level.  Studies show that just playing a few games of basketball at a low intensity doesn’t burn much fat.  This is why we created this program to improve one’s overall fitness. Each session is an obstacle course including fun basketball related exercises. That will increase strength, stamina, flexibility and enhance skills.

Classes will be held every Tuesday and Thursday from 6-8pm beginning June 2, 2016. At Washington Hall Park in Brooklyn, NY. This is for people who hate to work out but love to play basketball.  Participants move at their own pace so no matter if you’re age 30 or 60 you can still enjoy a great workout. You will relieve stress have fun and improve your cardiovascular system. Each session will only cost $10.

We realized most people don’t like the idea of working out. Yet when involving something they love to do, the mind can be tricked into enjoying a great exercise. Our goal is to inspire people to do what they love no matter what it is. If it’s playing the game of basketball then so be it.

“You’re never too old to play the game you love”

We are a combined network of passionate people who love to play the game.  Basketball is a form of meditation, a release from the stress that life can bring. Being in shape enhances the joy you will have while playing, that’s also one of the reasons that motivated this company. This will be our first year offering our services to the community for all to enjoy.  To learn more please contact us at adultbasketballcardio@gmail.com

###
results.name: Adult Basketball Cardio

results.description:
Real Estate investing can be overwhelming especially if you are just starting out. Why go at it alone? 

There are too many courses to buy, guru's to follow, coaching, mentoring programs that many beginners get information overload and never take action. Having the right knowledge is key and there is no better teacher than experience don't lose money trying to figure it all out on your own. 

There are 4 things Each Invest Must Do: 

1. Find Cheap Houses 

2. Analyze Deals 

3. Make Offers 

4. Find Buyers 

This is a group for anyone interested in real estate investing as a team sport. We find ,analyze, make offers and market profitable real estate deals as a team. We specialize in co-wholesaling and join venture fix and flip deals. Wholesaling is the easiest way to get started in real estate because you don't need any of your own money or credit. 

But beginners are faced with a chicken or egg problem. They don't have a Buyer's List and they are afraid to get a property under contract because they may not be able to sell it before the closing date. 

With Co-wholesaling you don't have to have both a buyer's list and a property under contract you can market a property that another group member already has under contract. Why would you want to do that? You get a chance to build a buyer's list by marketing a real property if you find a buyer you get paid a % of the wholesaler's fee if not you are still building a buyer's list from all the buyers that contacted you. If you are great at finding deals then you get a bunch of free marketing to sell more properties faster. 


Joint Venture Fix and Flip deals are a way to leverage your capital For example: a group of 5 people with $20K each can find, analyze, offer, fix and market a deal they bought for $50K +50K rehab and sell for $200K each profiting $20K + their original investment. 

The purpose of this group is to provide a structured format for team real estate investing by combining learning with hands on action taking. 

Let's do some deals together!
results.name: Co-Wholesaling & Joint Venture Real Estate Meetup

topics.name: Accelerated Learning: Learning How To Learn

results.description:
We dream of a world in which each individual is fully aware and engaged in a life of shared learning and discovery. This conversation series will create a collaborative, positive, diverse learning community to share learnings, perspectives, insights, reflection, wisdom and casual observations between members around a variety of topics of interest to the members.

L2O is a new social network designed to inspire us all to experience life through the lens of a learning mindset. We believe engaged, deliberate recording of everyday learnings and sharing these with others we can trust will help us all to adopt the learning mindset across various aspects of our personal and professional lives. Our conversation series will include group sessions of shared learning as well as other inspirational learners who will catalyze our discussions.

We are looking for members who are interested in a lifetime of continued learning. Our meetups will include learners from all walks of life, and the discussion will revolve around their ideas for how to remain curious and open-minded in today's world. Consistent with our goal, we will initiate and follow each conversation with group discussion in smaller and larger groups.  We will include learners from the worlds of science, art, religion, philosophy, education, environment, food, health, politics, etc. - anyone who is passionate about the world, about constantly learning and reflecting, and can offer a unique perspective.  If these discussions sound like something you would learn from and contribute to, we hope you'll join us.

Members will receive invites to our discussions and talks and will be among the first to know when we have product updates or new launches. Our events will be a place to reflect, discuss some things with others who share a curious mindset, and walk away with your brain feeling refreshed!  Right now most of our events will be in NYC (mostly Manhattan), but in the coming months we will be expanding - to request a speaker or topic, please reach out to Feedback@l2o.com!
results.name: L2O:  Learn for Life (Conversations)

results.description: This group is for like-minded men who are looking to make physical and mental improvements to their life but they are having a hard time doing it alone. Research show's that being a part of a community that shared your goals is integral to achieving them. Personally, I've always participated in team sports or activities like football, wrestling, rugby, and martial arts. What keeps me coming back and engaged is the community and camaraderie inherent in these group activities. Weightlifting is another matter though. I know my way around a gym, but lifting alone is difficult for me. The lack of accountability and engagement usually leads me to modifying routines that shouldn't be modified or abandoning lifting all together and focussing on my group activities (Currently Brazilian Jiu Jitsu). So my goal for this group is to find some more buddies who want to partner with me on lifting. I'm going to be on the program outlined in "Man 2.0, Engineering the Alpha." This group is for guys like me, to find other guys like me, so that we can do this together! While I have a specific program that I want to engage, this group will serve as a hub for other guys in our situation to meet one another, find someone else who wants to engage in a program of your choosing and move onward!
