topics.name: Aikido Self Defense Classes - Private & Group

results.description:
Aikido is a unique martial art, the full power of which is rarely seen. From a self-defense aspect it can end an attack suddenly, severely and decisively or dissipate it with the gentleness of a soft breeze.


Aikido's unique approach is to blend with an attack rather than clash with it. The attack is redirected safely away into a throw or pin. Its circular, flowing techniques are effective and can be learned by anyone regardless of size, age or gender. Men, women, children and seniors all find it appealing because Aikido techniques are not based on pitting one's strength against another's. Students learn to defend themselves without resorting to aggressive or violent behavior. Self esteem, concentration, awareness and focusing power are enhanced. Balance and calmness are therefore maintained in all situations. This state of being is then carried off the mat and into the activity and interactions of daily life.

Aikido Centers was established in 1988 after Sensei O'Connor had been studying and teaching for 12 years. At Aikido Centers we teach traditional Aikido as handed down by Aikido's founder, Morihei Ueshiba.

Aikido Centers is the largest traditional Aikido dojo organization in New Jersey. We currently have traditional Aikido dojos in East Hanover, Sparta, Paterson, Manasquan, Summit (at the Summit YMCA), River Edge, Montclair, Marlboro and in Lancaster, PA
results.name: Introduction to Aikido

results.description:
This group has been created for the benefit of the real state community in New York City. 

Landlords, Owners, Real Estate Managers, Real Estate Brokers, Engineers, Architects, Mechanical Contractors, Plumbers, PLC Programmers, Electrical Contractors, and other professionals who identify themselves with this group description; all these profiles are very welcome to meet this group. 

The promoters of this group have extensive experience in designing and implementing control systems to provide energy-efficiency, savings, safety and comfort in both residential and commercial buildings. 

New York City has around 1 million buildings considering residential and commercial buildings together, and many of them have substandard heating systems. 

Some of the scenarios that can be found in old buildings are: 

• Heating rooms without any digital control. 

• Heating rooms with some kind of digital control but with no control inside the apartments. 

• Digital systems integrated in the facility but not working or doing what it is supposed to do, or how the property would like.  

• Facilities with or without digital control not offering the necessary data to know how is working the building in terms of energy-efficiency. 

• During the winter time, tenants receiving too much heat in their apartments and having to open the windows to lower the temperature, while others complaint because they do not receive enough heating in their apartments. 

• Boilers experimenting heating interruptions and supers/managers/owners receiving complaints for bad service or no heating water in the apartments. 

• Oil tanks becoming empty without any previous notice or alarm. 

• Facilities with several control panels installed without any efficient-efficiency criteria. 

• Buildings with high consumption spending. 

• Equipment with very low or without acceptable safety standards. 

For all the scenarios mentioned above, but for many others there are excellent, affordable, and reliable solutions. 

This group pretends to facilitate the communication in between professionals related to the real estate industry, to exchange professional experiences, share valuable knowledge, exchange business cards, but also to generate business opportunities for all of them. 

We hope this is considered as a good networking opportunity to have real business chances for the benefit of the entire community.
results.name: Energy Efficiency and Safety for Buildings in NYC

results.description:
Super Smash Melee, Wii U & Brawl tournaments and weekly practice battles!

Calling all Super Smash Bros players! Beginners, Amateurs & pros.  Do you have the skills to be the best? Do you want to win cash prizes, gift certificates and champion recognition for being the best?
Then this meetup group is for you.

Super smash bros tournaments (for WII U) around New York City, but mostly in Williamsburg Brooklyn. There will be  several types of Tournaments. Standard Tournament, two tag team and the Royal battle tournament. 

Beginners, Amateurs and Pros are welcomed to practice on non-tournament days (Sun 1pm-6pm, Mon 6pm-1am, Wednesday 6pm-11pm).

1. Standard Tournament - One on one battles, best two out of three per round played on two 55" big screen televisions. Winners will advance to the next round, until the final championship battle. First prize winners will win $40-$100 in cash or gift certificates (depending on how many people show up). Second and Third place will win gift certificates.

2. Ultimate Action Tournament - (Designed by Action Burger) 5-10 rounds, eight players per tv (two televisions, A & B). Every round, the last place person will be eliminated. Matches will count down to final 1st round, where three final players will battle it out for first, second and third place. The battle continues, 6 final players from televisions A & B, will play against each other in teams, 3 vs 3, in a best of 2 out of 3 final battle. The team that wins will win the tournament. The 1st, 2nd & 3rd place winners will win their prizes in their original previous game order. So, what are you waiting for? Sign up!  Have a question, ask the group.

**Don't RSVP if you aren't 100% sure you can make it that day for the Tournament.  You must give 12 hour notice if you plan to cancel, so standby RSVPs can enter the contest.  RSVP's on standby must be ready to goto tournament if they move into an open slot.  Please be considerate of other members who really want to compete.  Practice days doesn't matter.

Members will be given a warning if you violate these rules, you do it again, then you'll be booted out of the group for 90 days.  This applies to all tournaments, practice days doesn't matter.

results.description: The Latosa Escrima System The philosophy behind the Latosa Escrima system is very simple; the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. For example, a technique does not work by itself unless combined with the concepts of balance, power, speed, focus, timing, and attitude. When combining these elements, the outcome or whole is far more effective then what would normally be the sum of the parts. This is the reason techniques, as practiced in the system, are only tools used to understand, accept and retain these ideas. The number of different techniques mastered by an individual does not increase his level of competence in this system. Techniques are only practiced moves until combined with the proper fighting concepts. The ultimate goal of the martial arts is to make your mental, physical and technical skills work as one. The goal of Latosa Escrima is to do this while producing a quality Escrimador who can think creatively and react responsively rather than giving people information overload. Escrima was the original name used under the flag of the Philippine Martial Arts Society. The name changed to Combat Escrima as the system was influenced by the concept of using power and combat reality. Combat Escrima relied on a single goal; winning. This goal proved to be a very valuable asset. The intimidation factor of the name "Combat Escrima" was something the students felt they had to defend. However, just the goal of winning actually proved limiting in the progression of the system and future instructors. PMAS produced excellent fighters and world champions but failed to produce very many well-rounded instructors. PMAS had the box recipe for producing competent fighters but failed to isolate the individual ingredients that make up the end product. Latosa spent his time developing training methods used to understand the reasoning behind the techniques and isolating the concepts of Escrima. Wing Tzun is self defense in it's most consequent form Wing Tzun is the smartest self-defense system ever thought of by humankind, because Wing Tzun is not based upon physical strength or acrobatic ability and therefore allows a physically weaker person to defend him/herself. Wing Tzun teaches you to use the force of the opponent and turn it against him. Wing Tzun self defense movements derive from tactile reflexes that are mechanical and directly determined by the attack of the opponent. In this way WT is not susceptible to optical manipulations meant to mislead the fighter. Wing Tzun can be learned fairly quickly and built upon. Wing Tzun meets the demands of "appropriate force" and therefore lends itself for use by law enforcement.
results.name: Latosa Escrima and Wing Tsun Meetup

results.description:
Learn and Play the Music of The Allman Brothers Band

PURPOSE:

Would you like to accurately learn and play the music of The Allman Brothers Band?  At each session, participants will learn two or three songs with song specific soloing strategies and extensive jamming.  Each session is two and a half hours.  Each session is limited to six participants.

The objective of these workshops is for individuals to express their developing concepts and performance skills in an organized context through the use of charts that demonstrate specific song forms while learning soloing strategies that are song specific.  Additionally, the workshop will foster stronger group cohesion, rhythmic synchronization, and group groove. Participants will learn how to develop their musicianship more quickly by utilizing modern technology.

I have been coordinating Allman Brothers Band Song and Jam groups since 2010.  The same group of people have been getting together monthly to play and celebrate the music of the ABB.  These sessions are a lot of fun.  Now, through Meet Up.com, I'm looking to help more folks learn to play the music of the ABB with others.

WHO SHOULD JOIN:

This group is open to any and all instrumentalists and vocalists.  Drums, bass, keys and guitarists learn to interlock and groove.  Vocalists learn to place their melody into the wideness of the beat.  Attention to detail is spent on tempos, grooves, and dynamics.  Charts notate where in the beat the chords change.  Participants learn song specific soloing strategies to develop dramatically compelling solos.  Refinement of details transforms an ordinary song rendition into the highest level playing experience. 

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN:

The music of The Allman Brothers Band is a lot of fun to play solo and with others.  However, learning the music of the ABB can be problematic because there are many versions of any single song.    This is how I can help you learn.  This song and jam group is organized and structured so that participants actually learn the music the way the ABB played it.  The charts I use relate to specific studio and/or live performances and function as default arrangements.  I learned these parts from recordings and videos of band performances.  The charts are clear about song form, intros,  chord progressions, turnarounds, interludes and endings.  Both Duane Allman and Dicky Betts' parts will be taught. The charts demonstrate the correct rhythms, chord voicings, riffs and song form. In most cases, Berry Oakley's bass lines have been transcribed.  The ABB shows that compositions may be flexible and improvisations may be structured.

Note to budding song writers and improvisers - understanding song form helps one to better develop a dramatic arc, memorize songs more easily and improves one’s ability to improvise and compose.

WHAT YOU CAN LEARN:

As we learn each song, participants will learn the correct chord progressions and song forms; the actual chord voicings; specific chord progressions used during the improv sections; slide guitar techniques; pentatonic/blues boxes for soloing; chord/scale combinations; use of chromaticism; inversion of guitar roles; use of triads; alternating triads as an improvisational tool; modal scales as an improvisational tool; variations on tone production through the use of hybrid picking; and rhythm guitar adaptations of keyboard parts using two and three-note voicings with palm muting techniques. 

As the group coordinator, I will discuss how to build solos and the group will jam on those songs.  This is an opportunity to master your soloing skills.  However, there is no obligation to improvise.  There won’t be any pressure to do so.  People may simply strum along and enjoy that participation.

Although actual songs that the group covers is at the coordinator's discretion, group suggestions play a big part.  In previous sessions we have learned and jammed on many songs including:   Staesboro Blues, Trouble No More, Don't Keep me Wonderin', Done Somebody Wrong, One Way Out, Ain't Wastin' Time No More, Dreams, Blue Sky, Hot 'Lanta, In Memory of Elizabeth Reed, Little Martha, Midnight Rider, Mountain Jam, Stormy Monday, Whipping Post, You Don't Love Me and others.

ABOUT THE COORDINATOR:

I am a professional musician with over 40 years experience. I began playing the guitar at four years old and performing professionally at 15.  I've performed all over the world at countless venues and festivals.  Additionally, I teach privately and at a variety of music schools.  As a performer and recording artist I play many styles of music including rock, blues, jazz and folk.
results.name: New York City Allman Brothers Band Song and Jam

results.description:
From Healing Practitioner to Healer:
Healing Spirituality as a Life Journey
Taught by Robert Vetter
It’s quite possible to learn a myriad of healing techniques without ever learning how to heal. In this lively, interactive workshop, Robert Vetter deconstructs processes of spiritual healing found in cultures found all over the world, and shares a formula for healing that can be adapted to almost any energetic or spiritual healing discipline. By looking at the methods of other cultures, you will understand on a deeper level what healing is, how it works, and the ways that various healers master a universal code that underlies the healing process.

Workshop topics include:

• Understanding your calling as a healer
• Developing a healing presence
• Respectfully borrowing healing practices from other cultures
• Constructing altars to invoke the power of symbols in healing
• Engaging all 5 senses in healing
• Grasping a deeper meaning that underlies the wounded healer archetype
• Methods of self-protection that you can implement in your practice
• The power of narrative medicine: using words to heal
• Acquiring healing energy
• Soul retrieval and re-integration

During this workshop, you will develop your own unique healing protocol that is a reflection of who you are on your individual journey. In learning to heal using this method, you will also uncover how healing is a spiritual path that directs us through the entire cycle of human life, imbuing it with meaning and purpose.

Robert Vetter, M.A. is a cultural anthropologist, who began his studies of cross cultural healing practices at the University of Oklahoma in the 1980’s. He has apprenticed and learned from a variety of teachers in modalities that include traditional Mesoamerican medicine (Curanderismo), Native North American medicine, and Medical or Healing Qigong among others. He maintains a healing practice in what he calls Ethno-Energetic Healing. He is the co-author (along with his adopted uncle, Kiowa medicine man, Richard Tartsah) of the book Big Bow: The Spiritual Life and Teachings of a Kiowa Family. He is vice president of Joshua’s Place Center for Healing in Southampton, NY. He has taught at the New York Open Center, Wainwright House, Mount Madonna Center in the San Francisco Bay area, The Sanctuary at Mount Shasta, and many other venues.

Exchange: $65
results.name: Healing Spirituality As A Life Journey

results.description: PMDD is more than a little bloating and cramping before a period. It is a mood disorder that accompanies the other premenstrual symptoms. The PMDD gets more severe as the period draws near, escalating the sufferer to a state of very high tension, anxiety and aggression. It enhances other coexisting mood disorders to complicate any treatment for several days during the month. PMDD is thought to be a brain chemistry malfunction that is triggered by ovulation. Symptoms usually begin after ovulation and last into the first days of the period. This cycle repeats itself every month. PMDD is tied to the hormonal changes triggered by ovulation, so it does not occur without this part of the menstrual cycle. The condition affects up to 8 percent of women. The condition involves much more than a bad time during a period. It is cyclical, occurring at the same point in the menstrual cycle each month. The symptoms of PMDD are severe and usually life altering. Doctors require sufferers to have at least five of the following symptoms to support a diagnosis: Depression of hopeless feelings Feelings of anxiousness, tension or edge Irritability that increases as period nears Oversleeping or insomnia Lack of interest in favorite things No motivation Loss of energy Difficulty focusing and concentrating Loss of control feelings, feeling overwhelmed Severe physical manifestation of PMS symptoms like tender breasts, cramping, bloating, muscle pain and weight gain Suicidal thoughts Source: http://www.psychguides.com/guides/living-with-premenstrual-dysphoric-disorder/ Message from Organizer: Last year I learned that I have PMDD. The only thing I found that truly helps the mental aspect of PMDD is joining online forums where other women discuss their experiences with PMDD, thus learning that I am not alone. I am making this group so members can meet and give support to other PMDD suffers. I'm calling the members "Lunar Girls" because of how we're affected by our cycle, much like the moon. I thought about calling us werewolves but that seemed a bit extreme. Any better suggestions will be considered.
results.name: New York Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder (PMDD) Support

results.description: The goal of the Collective Song Club is to create a nurturing space for songwriters, artists and producers to present their works in progress, completed songs and productions as well as ask questions about the music business. Vetting songs about to be recorded will give you one more moment of clarity and reflection before you spend energy and dollars on your recording. Song tempos and keys can be discussed as well as best possible producers and vocalists for your project. The studio will have guitars and a keyboard available so no need to feel you have to bring your own. The studio can playback a CD, your iPhone or Android, MP3 player, or connect via the internet to your website or Dropbox. Bring a few lyric sheets of the song you would like to share. The entire evening is about forming a creative community that enhances your art and helps you grow as a songwriter. The Song Club is led by the founder of the Collective -Peter Bliss. The Collective Song Club” will begin on October 14th and follow every other Wednesday evening (skipping the night before Thanksgiving). It will take place at Planet Studio NYC (www.planetstudionyc.com) 244 West 54th Street between Broadway and 8th Avenue in Suite 800B on the 8th floor. It will begin at 5:30PM so those heading home from work can stop in without it getting too late. Each session will end promptly at 8:30pm when the studio will go back into record mode for the evening schedule. Drop in at anytime up until 7:30pm during each session. You can’t even really be late! Leave when you like! There will be no advance payment or sign-up necessary. Each session will cost $20 per person payable at the door as we begin. The studio has a “Square” reader so you can put it on your debit / credit card for $22 with the additional sum to cover the handling charge. Come one week or skip a session - feeling inspired - come on down - feeling tired or have a change of plans - there’s no need to feel like you have to be there. Sessions might be crowded - some might be just a few people - or you! There are no requirements other than to become a full member of the Collective. The annual membership fee until the end of 2015 is only $35. This membership entitles you to participate in all the Collective workshops as well as perform a song (or have your song performed) in our quarterly Member Benefit Showcases held at the Bitter End. It's easy to become a member - go to www.newyorksongwriterscollective.com and look for "Sign Up/Sign In" in he top right corner of the webpage! The CSC is an experiment that will hopefully find a place and grow with the necessary changes and additions as it is established. Could it happen every week save for special days and holidays? Could special guests from the industry drop in that would be announced shortly before a session on the Collective website? We shall see! Join us for our first session on October 14th and let’s see what happens! Peter Bliss / Profile: Peter Bliss songs have been recorded by artists like Barbra Streisand, NYSNC, Peter Wolf of J.Geils Band, Southside Johnny, and many more. Peter’s journey began as an artist/songwriter releasing his United Artists debut LP in his early twenties. He continued writing and producing for artists, television and film. He’s shared his expertise creating workshop and event programs for the Songwriters Hall of Fame and now the New York Songwriters Collective. Peter works from his “Planet Studio NYC” recording studios located in Manhattan, arranging, recording and producing other artists to help bring their music to life. Peter is once again taking to the stage singing his own songs.
results.name: New York Songwriters Collective

topics.name: Taking steps towards your goals and dreams

results.description:
This group will not work for everyone, and is only for people who are seriously committed to upping their game.

I created this group with the sense that there were other people out there like me whose productivity could increase tenfold with the right combination of accountability, moral support, and proper systems in place. 

If you are a creative and conscientious person who struggles to balance multiple roles, goals and projects, then this may be the group for you.

We’ll help each other stick to all of our commitments by providing a group atmosphere of accountability, moral support, and a “reality check” on how our short term (weekly) plans relate to our long term (yearly and quarterly) goals. 

To be in this group you must: 

1. Have a list of goals and projects for the next year. 

2. Have a list of sub-goals for each quarter which define your yearly goals. 

3. Have a realistic plan that allocates consistent time and resources to said goals, weekly. 

4. Meet at 7am every Friday (or a day that works for everyone) on google hangouts for a weekly check-in and review of the above. (A warning to non-morning people: I am insisting on an early AM meeting time, and there are multiple reasons for this, which are all based in sound psychological principles). 

5. Discuss what strategies are working for you and what strategies are not. 

6. Contribute useful ideas and a supportive attitude towards other group members. 

7. Agree to make progress on your stated goals to the best of your ability for the next week. 

Once a quarter (every 3 months) we will meet in person and celebrate everyone’s victories by voting on and participating in a fun group activity in person (voting will be done via google survey distributed by the Organizer).
results.name: Goals & Accountability for Creative People

The 2015-16 LIC Hoops Indoors Season has now concluded.  Join us again in November 2016.


Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City. We play every Monday and Wednesday evening that public schools are open from 7pm-8:45pm at the High School on Center Boulevard (aka Academy of Careers for Television and Film, 1-50 51st Avenue, Long Island City NY). The cost is $10.75 per session, and you only play when you want - you do not have to commit to the season or a specific day. //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////   But you must RSVP and pay in advance via Meetup.com. Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session. //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////   It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two full-court games simultaneously with each playing 4x4 on the side baskets. We will break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting. ////////////////////////////////////////////////////   Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym. No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game. ////////////////////////////     From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).
results.name: LIC Hoops - Men's Indoor Pickup Basketball in Hunters Point

topics.name: Support for Mothers with Adult Disabled Children

results.description: Welcome.... FINALLY, a " Meet Up" for high functioning young adults living at home or a group home. I am specifically talking about the young people with disabilities that can do so much more socially and want to, but that their socialization some how ends at the programs they attend for various reasons. They do not have friends in the neighborhood, and want to "fit in" so badly but don't! Parents, I say ENOUGH, it's got to start with us! Please if you are as frustrated as I am, lets get together, and HELP! Lets help and brainstorm and make this happen! I personally, have a 32 yr old high functioning daughter at home, who is lucky enough to have a 34 yr. old sister who loves and adores her. But as we all know 'its not enough"! These young people need friends, they need their peers! They need movie dates, bowling dates, parties to attend, or just taking turn hang out at each others house. Parents, as you have already found out the first step to help will always be family. I am looking for dedicated mothers, fathers, sisters , brothers or whoever that family member might consist of. If your plain tired and sad of seeing your grown young adult home alone on the entire weekend with no plans , no friends, or sitting in their room watching a funny movie alone then reach out and lets move forward together. It just begins with one or two of us to start a network of friends for are kids, then before you know it, they are no longer alone!
results.name: Socializing For High Functioning Young Adults in Westchester

results.description:
By 2020, NOAA, NASA, other governmental agencies, will collect and publish over an Exabyte of climate data each year, confronting scientists, economists, policy makers, and businesses with enormous challenges in analyzing this data and relating it to everyday decisions. Climate Change hurts the weak and poor exponentially harder than the strong and rich. That's true for nations, communities, and families. The accumulation of Climate Data will increasingly allow Data Scientists to discover early warning signs of climate changes that will effect vulnerable populations.

This Meetup Group is established to develop the methodologies, skills, and capabilities to discover leading data indicators of social impacts of climate change and their tertiary consequences for communities, governments, and businesses. The goal is to pro-actively identify risks and mitigate before exposure become too large to control.

The geographical scope of this group is global.  You can join no matter where you live and you can become a co-organizer and organize meetups and other activities wherever your community is located.
results.name: Climate Data Meetup

results.description: "So when I get old you'll take of me....right?" With the mortality rate increasing and medical science getting better and better as time goes by people are begining to live much longer then ever before. But when we get older, and need assistance with daily living activities, are we going to want to place the responsibility for our care on the shoulders of our loved ones? It's not just hands-on care: 8 percent of baby boomers, 13 percent of Generation X and 19 percent of millennials are financially supporting a parent, to the tune of $12,000 a year, according to a survey of 1,000 adults released this summer from TD Ameritrade. Of those, 31 percent said they are also caregivers for that parent. From 2012 to 2050, the Census Bureau projects, the size of the U.S. population age 65 and older will nearly double. The ranks of the so-called "old old," those 85-plus, will more than triple over that period. Among adults age 51 to 54, 82.8 percent are currently "at risk" of needing to provide care for a parent or in-law due to health concerns, according to a 2014 report from The Urban Institute. Yet paid care is out of reach for many. Please come down on November 17th to the New York Life building in Lake Success, NY and attend a free educational workshop on long term care and the many options that are available for us to avoid creating any future hardships for our family members Feel free to contact me for any further information 516-359-8696 Anyone interested in learning about long term care is welcome to join. Please RSVP as soon as you can and reserve your seats!
results.name: New York Long Term Care Meetup

results.description:
Some of my favorite memories involve being outdoors, camping, Skiing, Biking, Swimming, Beaching, indoor rock Climbing, Hiking, Traveling and exploring the world.
New activities to try include fishing, survival skills, Surfing, kayaking etc. Don't be intimidated we will go slow and accommodate newbies. All you need is a desire to try new things.

But in a sea of 100 outdoor and adventure enthusiasts 5% might be black or of color if you're lucky. There has to be folks like me out there who get turned on by the scent of firewood or are transported by breathing deeply outdoors (Not in the city). 

This group is for you, let's come together, build a fun and open community and promote black people doing non-traditional things. We'll do trips together and eat each other's food -- It will be great!

This will be an open, positive environment--No cliques but bring the attitude, personality and outdoor spirit.

Note: Profile photo must show you, not a flower or your spirit animal!

Join Us - See You outside!

Read More (Heres some hilarious and insightful articles I found while searching the topic)

• Cypher Avenue: Why Don’t Black People Like the Great Outdoors?

• Brandon Harris: Why Is Camping a White Thing? A Few Wild Theories 

You'll also want to join our Private Fb Community to chat and get to know other members aka your new squadmates better.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4wlgL5br7Jk

This Meet Up is available to YMCA members only- Sorry! Club/high school Varsity level of play or better. NO BEGINNERS PLEASE!!!

Please BRING a WHITE shirt and a DARK shirt. The soccer field is located in the west side of the complex.

This Meet Up is every Thursday at the Y from 8:00pm to 10:00pm. As opposed to past years, WE WILL START PROMPTLY.  Space is limited to 16 players in total. 

If you are on the waiting list, DO NOT show up unless you received an email that a spot has opened up AND you have confirmed through Meet Up that you will be taking the open spot!!! 

If you are bringing a friend they must be a YMCA member. Please make sure you RSVP for them also.

NOTE: NO -SHOWS -- If YOU RSVP AND THEN DO NOT SHOW UP ( TWICE ) YOU WILL BE REMOVED FROM THE GROUP! 

If you're not a YMCA member, you can still come down for an evening to see if you're interested in playing with us regularly. Go online to the YMCA site, get a one time free pass for the evening. You can also call the Y on 15th street and ask for a free pass. www.ymcanyc.org The Y is a non-profit!!! That means they offer financial aid if you can't afford the membership. topics.name: Haiti Disaster Relief and Recovery Assistance
Let's Run and Donate to Aid the Haiti Survivors

results.description:
Come to the Upper East Side for dinner and bottomless drinks on a spacious terrace overlooking Central Park! This is a one-time event to raise money for a school in Jacmel, Haiti.

In September 2010, I traveled to Haiti as a volunteer to help with recovery efforts after the country was rocked by a 7.0 magnitude earthquake. I stayed in Jacmel, teaching remedial French classes and working on construction projects. My first week there, I took a basic Haitian Creole lesson, taught by a young man named Fanel Leme. He was a great teacher, and we became friends over the course of my time there. He would hang out with the volunteers outside of class and take us around the city, exposing us to life in Jacmel we would have otherwise missed. He was a great friend and ambassador to Haitian culture.

Now Fanel is pursuing his passion for education, starting a daycare in his hometown, Eagle Kindergarten. In a place where a lot of children are left roaming the streets while their parents eke out a living, his school is an invaluable service to the community. Everything Fanel has accomplished so far is a testament to how resourceful he is: he's built a classroom, and provided uniforms and supplies, all from his own pockets and donations. He recently reached out to me and asked if I would be able to help him build a kitchen for the kids. Sadly, most of them don't get packed lunches from their parents/caregivers before they're sent off to school. Having meals at school would be a huge leap for their education and overall health.

The goal of this dinner is to raise the funds necessary to finish the construction of Eagle Kindergarten’s kitchen. The cost per guest is will be minimum donation of $40. As I said at the top, there’s going to be delicious food, bottomless drinks, and music, all in a spacious apartment with a large terrace overlooking Central Park – perfect ingredients for a great time, especially when it’s for a good cause!

Here are some links to the gofundme page I started for Eagle Kindergarten, and Fanel's facebook page for the school:

https://www.gofundme.com/6v4yz5bj

https://www.facebook.com/groups/88249510184...

Also, you can take care of the donation when you arrive for the dinner on Saturday, or you can get it out of the way now and I'll take note of which guests have already donated prior to the event.
results.name: Fundraising dinner for Haitian school

Our humble aim is to help others coping with the day-to-day complexities of this disease. We advocate for the dignity, respect, and agency of all human beings—particularly the vulnerable, differently-abled, or marginalized. We embrace kindness as a core value and hope to enhance the lives of PWD, loved ones, and caregivers by:

• sharing stories and resources
• learning from guest speakers*
• exploring new technologies
• developing tools or products

We know you’re out there and how it feels to fare alone.

Let’s unite, interact, and make this Gerination great!

Learn from the source! 

Join a group of local enthusiasts and train with a reputed international Taiji Master (Master Wang Feng-Ming) who makes a weekly trip from Edison NJ to conduct a class in Stamford, CT. Master Wang Feng-Ming is an internationally reputed martial arts master specializing in Taiji, Qigong, and Baguazhang, and also a renowned writer in martial arts. He is the author of several books (in Chinese and a few in English) and has published more than 100 articles in martial arts magazines around the world. More than 20 martial arts organizations in various parts of the world have appointed Master Wang as honorary institute director, professor, or consultant. 

Master Wang is a disciple of Grand Master Feng Zhiqiang, the 10th generation successor to Chen Style Taijiquan. He is also a disciple of Liu Xinghan, the 4th generation successor to Baquazhang. Master Wang started martial arts training and practice at age eight in China. He has studied and taught martial arts for several decades, and won many awards in China and international martial arts and qigong competition. He is reputed as the "King of Neigong" and Master of Taiji and Qigong. 

Chen Style Hun Yuan Taiji Teaching Program 

• Taiji Quan Form - 24, 48, 83 (Yi Lu)

• Taiji Push Hands 

• The Form and application for Attack and Defense 

• Taiji Weapons 

• Taiji Eight Methods 

• Many Kinds of Taiji Power 

Feel free to join us for a trial session to see if it suits!  We always look forward to meeting fellow enthusiasts and new friends.

Tuition:

Core class ($120 for four sessions a month)  3:30 to 4:30 Old frame

Core class and push hands (Total $150 for four sessions a month)  Add 4:30 to 5:30pm Push Hands

Full class (Total $180 for four sessions) Add 5:30 to 6:00pm Sword form
